Do not eat here. This place is overpriced cheap terrible tasting Asian food. Panda Express is much better than this. I've never had worse asain food. The orange chicken was cold, was processed chicken and tasted worse than McDonald's chicken nuggets. Please fire the cooks! How could you have a place like this that gets terrible reviews and not make a change in the food?? My table also had other dishes and nobody liked their food. Even my lemonade tasted like water! How do you mess up lemonade?? $100 later and not happy!

Worst place. You could get any corner of any city better Chinese food than this place. 
It used to be a great restaurant. I wonder what happened.
It's located inside Mandalay Bay.

We are staying at the Mandalay Bay and were looking for something open on a Friday at 10:45.  I am on a gym challenge and really just wanted a salad or anything "clean."  I had my own chicken in the room. 
Noodle Shop was still seating. The waiter assured me that the stir fry veggies would be mostly steamed.  I asked him for seasoned chicken to be added, but not oil or caloric sauces.  Our food arrived in less than five minutes.  My food was drenched in a brown sauce, but the chicken tasted very blah as if no seasonings were added.  My husband said his Kung Pao Chicken tasted Americanized.  It looked like the same sauce that I had, but thicker.   I also had a medium length black hair in my food.  We didn't complain at the time, unfortunately, but it was a very disappointing meal.

Too overpriced, definitely do not recommend coming here. Our waiter was a lady who wasn't welcoming at all whatsoever. Although, the manager whose tall and slim was efficient in checking in on our table to see how we are doing rather than our actual waiter who gave attitude and slow service. I also wasn't impressed with the quality of the food. I guess I had high expectations due to their prices.  Definitely not worth it. Very clean and fancy restaurant though.

The Noodle Shop was good.

I know most Asian places in Las Vegas, on the strip in the hotels (not including Panda Express types) tend to be expensive, in the realm of 2x - 3x the price you'd find at Chinatown, with maybe some Asian naysayers touting the possible whitewashing and lack of authenticity of some Chinese restaurants.

Let me tell you 'tho... I've tried most of the overpriced Chinese restaurants in the high end hotels, and I've never had a bad meal.  Sure, there is a bit of sticker shock when you see the menu and get the bill, but the food is indeed delicious and good most of the time.

So, with that I do give 'em the * * * A-OK rating, which I would say I'd come back again and also would refer others to try.

This was the place to stop by after that late or tweener flight into vegas.  It was nice to go somewhere casual after getting in, have a bowl of noodles.  Yes.... it was a bit expensive, but for "strip" eating, its about par.... par meaning about 40% high, but with good service to match.

This place is absolutely awful. Then Pho is disgusting and the dumplings or Shumai gave one of my team members food poisoning. Literally some of the worst (and overpriced) food in Vegas. Stay far, far away.

I use to count on this place for a good bowl of pho or BBQ pork soup. But times have changed. 
Our party of three had both of the above, orange chicken, spring rolls and scallion pancakes and NONE of it was edible.
Pho-looked like gray dirty dish water
and tasted same. 
BBQ Pork Soup- Not sure how they accomplished this but the pork was bone dry even in the soup. 
Spring rolls-way too greasy. 
Orange Chicken-see Spring rolls. 
Scallion Pancake-See Spring Rolls. 
Wake up Mandalay and hold your restaurants accountable to have a little pride in what they serve.

I don't know what all the bad reviews are about. My family and I had dinner here and we got huge portions everyone shared their food! It was great! Servers and waiter were super sweet. The food came out fast. I would definitely recommend this place. Try their beef chow fun it's amazing!

Very good hong kong style food. I don't know why it's only a two star but as a chinese person, the food is authentic. Smaller portion than I expected but all food is overpriced on the strip. Waited super nice too.

Came here for lunch - long wait, restaraunt slow to clear tables, to the point where one member of our party who was in restaraunt management boldly walked in and started bussing tables!  They got the point.

People who complain about the language barrier outta just get over their egos and learn from the experience.  Be patient, speak slowly, listen attentively.  

High prices.  Ok food.  I had the seafood tom kha, which was loaded with squid and shrimp and noodles.  Broth just ok,  i expected a lot more flavor.  We ordered a calamari appetizer that was below par.

Large parties are charged 18% gratuity, which we were not informed of and created quite the headache afterward.

Two star due to value. $100 for 4 bowls of soup and an appetizer.  Take a cab to ChinaTown, better food and you'll save money.
This place is amazing!!! I have no clue what everyone was talking about my priest blessed the food

Give me a break.
Come on Mandalay! Take a hard look and tell me this place is in any way decent?
From the empty seats (should be your first clue), to the criminally bad dishes, it's amazing this place still stands. Rip the whole thing out and drop in something worthy. Please.

This last attempt was my second try. Shame on me.

Order the Pad Thai with chicken and see what it looks, smells and tastes like. Oh, and it's $18.

There aren't that many places open for lunch at Mandalay, so I was surprised that this place wasn't more crowded.  There is nothing special about this place, but just a quick place to drop in and get something to eat.  The orange chicken was decent, but nothing worth coming back for.

A little pricey, but worth it.  This is my second favorite place to eat at Mandalay.  It definitely hits the spot when craving a good noodle bowl with quality ingredients.  The proteins are not grisly like a lot of noodle restaurants.  The service always seems to be a little slow, but you really can't go wrong here.  Try it!

This place has the worst food ever. We ordered Pho and it was bland. Even putting the sriracha and hoisin sauce was still nasty. Guess how much they charge for a bowl!? 18 bucks! Seriously? Here in Oakland it's 7-8 bucks and it's delicious. Now I understand why it's expensive cuz its a hotel rest. but damn at-least make ur pho better..We also ordered pad Thai and it wasn't good. If you want to get pho go to Chinatown in Vegas it's way better and cheaper. It's not that far. Customer service sucks at this place too. Came here cuz we were in a rush. We didn't want the Pacquiao bus leaving us to go to LA.
Very much over-priced place. They charge something like $15 for 4 shrimp dumplings. Shocked.

Being of Asian descent, I always look for a place that serve a hot long noodle soup.  This place inside the Mandalay Bay Casino has such a dish.  Certainly there are better places for that like in Venetian or Bellagio.  And no soups can beat the one in the Monte Carlo.  But to their defense, this is not their specialty.  They serve Chinese food.  Not the greatest in the world, but not bad either.  I like coming here since I rarely have to wait and can get your standard Chinese dishes at a reasonable price.
Pho soup was really good..  Service is okay but far from the best.  I would go with the pho or the wonton soup.

A-ok for a restaurant in our hotel.  We were here a few years ago with our daughter and her friends and it's a quick meal, a bit expensive but convenient if you are staying at the hotel.  Server was friendly since we speak Cantonese (enough to order lol).

It was not good. Would not go again.

Took them 20 min to bring the drinks - after we had 3 waiters and they took forever to come back and tell me they didn't have the drinks on the menu. 

The food was greasy and tasted just average. Service was slow And inconsistent. 

Don't bother
All 5 of us agreed that this was the worst asian restaurant we ever ate at. Avoid at all cost!

Really really not good. Very pricey - everything was watery for some reason - inside of egg rolls were mush, and noodles and dumplings in soup were tough - Many other places that are so much better to eat at Mandalay -

I'm pretty generous with my reviews...and I gave this place a shot despite the terrible reviews because I was starving and it is so conveniently located to Mandalay Bay hotel rooms. 

I ordered the XO shrimp udon to go and it was TERRIBLE. And after tax $31.  So disappointed =T
Service was great. Food was pretty good. I wasn't blown away. Not bad for a casual meal but definitely not for a date.

Disappointed!!! Don't come here. 

Horrible service!! Rude. 

Expensive but food was not worth it! 

My friends and I came here to get lunch and the soup we ordered was bland, the wontons were small and lacked flavor. The Thai food was extremely bland, and the the rice dishes....how can you mess up rice?!! 

When we asked the waiter to split the check , he made a big deal about it and gave us a scolding look and told us that we should have told him earlier. BUT HOW ARE WE SUPPOSE TO KNOW?!  No one told us ahead of time and all places let you asked for split checks at the end! 

Ridiculous. Don't come here. The waiter watched us write down how much tip we were giving him...he lingered behind us. And then picked up the receipt as soon as we put the pen down and stared at the tip amount in front of us and walked away without saying anything to us. 

So rude! Never coming back here!!! I think he might have also been the manager. Unbelievable.

We got orange chicken and pas Thai noodles.
Service was good but food was terrible.

Worst orange chicken of my life :(

Wish I had read the reviews first.  Really too expensive for what you get.  My daughter thought her tofu dish was kind of bland.  I got the shrimp wonton soup and it was decent.  My GF had a beef/rice noodle dish and thought it was just ok.

Our waiter was super friendly and did a good job.

some haiku's

Fifteen dollar Pho?
Oh hell no, I don't think so
We shared other stuff.

Vietnamese drip
The coffee helped me revive
After long weekend

We went in for a late dinner, about 9pm. Got the chicken chow mien and Singapore noodles. Both dishes came out pretty quick. Both were really tasty, and good size portions. Would have given 5 stars but for the cost.

We are ordering some wonton noodle soups and an appetizer of dim sum. Soup was just ok, the veggies were a little al dente and raw. The dim sum was ok, just a little sticky. The shu mai was a little dry on the edges and chewy. Lunch was okay but I'd probably look for other options within the resort.

I wish I had my phone on me before we ate at this place so I could've seen the bad reviews and decide to go somewhere else! The menu looked appetizing and promising but everything from the food to the service is just disappointing. I knew we should've left when we sat there for several minutes waiting for someone take our drink order.Three different people took our drink order but no one brought our drinks...it was so bizarre. Also, it was not busy when we arrived. There was one other table seated when we arrived. We were going to try the dumpling sampler until we were told it would take at least 20 minutes to prepare. I was going to try the Hong Kong noodles, but when the waitress described the dish to me, I decided to just go with the fried rice. My husband had the kung pao chicken, which was nothing special. The fried chicken lacked flavor and had more egg in every bite than anything else. If you want good food, keep walking, you won't find it here.

I should have Yelp'd to see the reviews for this so called Chinese food restaurant. If you want to pay for the atmosphere you are more than welcome to do so! The food was overpriced and not worth the money spent. My husband ordered a Mongolian Chicken instead of beef, they were not willing to change the price. I didn't even see any greens in his plate either!  I ordered a Dim Sum platter for two, which to my surprise was a serving for one. I would have gotten more at Ding Tai Fung! Oh by-the-way, they also charge you $5 for hot tea which is complimentary at other Chinese restaurants.

We shared a vegetable chow mein and vegetable spring rolls. There were barely any veggies in the chow mein and the spring rolls seemed like the standard frozen ones tossed into a deep fryer. I would only eat here again if drunk at 3 am with no where else to go. Service was fine.

The noodle soup with roasted duck was good, the grey goose martini I ordered tasted like a dirty dish towel. My wife sent back the Lettuce wraps saying they tasted like dog food. I didn't know she had eaten dog food before to compare. Who knew ?

I paid $20 for a seafood pan fried noodle that was pretty bland. I ordered takeout, so if I had to say one good thing about this place, its that it took them about 5 minutes to make my food.

Other than that, if you're at the casino and you're hungry, do yourself a favor and get out to In-N-Out. Or, walk across the street to Panda Express and/or McDonald's.
Honestly horrible. Ordered tofu pad Thai and got chicken, plus it was just tasteless. The rice was overdone. There were more bean sprouts than actual rice. No flavor whatsoever. Never again.
Don't bother. I was served lukewarm cashew chicken that was under cooked. They took it off my bill but seemed to not understand why I didn't want it.

My wife and I were wandering around Mandalay Bay after visiting the shark exhibit and happened upon a The Noodle Shop. I did not check Yelp until after  we ordered our drinks and appetizer. I'm so happy we stopped there, the BBQ trio was lackluster at best. The chicken was rubbery, the pork was dry and the duck felt and tasted like it had been boiled. Please avoid this please. I expected more out of you Mandalay Bay.
Just had the worst crispy duck ever.  It is fat and not done.  Hard to eat.  The one star is for the waitress and the congee.

After coming to the Mandalay Bay for a few years and scoping out this place I knew that this trip we had to do it. I love any place that calls itself a noodle shop, especially one with the Asian flair. We found ourselves here for an early dinner and were quickly seated. It only took me a short few minutes before I knew I wanted it all. There was Laksa from Singapore, Ramen from Japan, Fried noodles from different provinces in China,l and the list went on and on. I ended up getting the Pork Ramen and the Duck with rice while my wife went with an assortment of different dumplings. Service was amazing especially the very personable manager that night who went from table to table in even more joy than myself this night. My Ramen was good, flavors were good with ample toppings to go with it, the noodles were very good. My duck was also very tasty and cooked perfectly to go with the rice and vegetables. Dumplings were o.k for the most part. Assorted dumpling platter seemed a bit small for the price but the chive dumplings were absolutely amazing even though they were overpriced. Overall I was happy with my experience, service like I said was amazing, from the manager to the buss boy. Prices were a bit high but I expect that at the Mandalay, and the food was good. I would definitely go back for another try next time I am in Vegas, Aloha
Signature House Noodles was disgusting. No flavor! Grosssssss!!!! Staff was nice! Place was neat but food was simply disgusting

We ordered Moo shoo Duck, Wonton Noodle Soup, and Pad Thai. The Moo Shoo Duck was a bit salty and the wrappers were dry and fell apart before anything was added to it. The wonton were really still and hard and you couldn't tell if there was shrimp in there or not. The noodles were soft, which was nice but not memorable. The Pad Thai was flavorless and the noodles were HARD!! 

The busboy who brought out the drinks was efficient. Our server who brought out our food was in some big rush even though the place was pretty empty. He reminded me of Jackie Chan, running around, carrying a zillion plates and putting them on our table so fast and talking a mile a minute that we could barely comprehend what was going on. 

The restaurant is pretty nice and clean, but I've had better food for half the price.

This place was an absolute joke! My husband and I were on vacation so we happen to get hungry while in the Mandalay Casino and decided this was most convenient. Our waitress (Wendy was her name) went straight to getting our drink orders and then came back to take our food order. She was not personable and she may hate her job. She then came back with our food and that was the last we saw of her. She didn't ask us how anything was or if our drinks needed refills. I then went to go pay for the bill and was just wanting to get out by that time. The lady at the cashier desk asked us how it was and after explaining our experience, she just said that she would speak to her after her shift. No apologies and nothing offered to help. A discount would've been nice being that the food was way better at any other food court eaten while we were there. But seriously don't even waste your time!!!

This is bay far the worst "asian" food I have ever had the displeasure of consuming.  My group of 6 needed to have a quick lunch, and since we were staying at the hotel, decided to give it a try.

We each ordered something different on the menu.  I went with the beef noodle soup, while my friends tried the pho, broccoli beef, mapo tofu, pad thai, and some chicken stir fry dish.  To my disbelief, each dish qualified as the worst version of these foods I have ever tasted.  They used the wrong sauces and the wrong noodles in each dish.  My friend that ordered the pho had to send it back (the first time he's ever had to do this at a restaurant).

This place should be shut down, then burned to the ground.

Please read, and listen to the reviews already published.  We, unfortunately did not.

Our review is primarily based on one menu item that we shared ... Malaysian Laksa Rice Noodle Soup.  This is described as a "Fragrant Coconut Curry Shrimp-Based Soup Served with Assorted Seafood".  $21,00 and plenty to share with an appetizer.  Sound great, right?

Reality .. a faint hint of coconut or curry, four medium shrimp hidden among the noodles and some "balls" of something.  With inquiry of our waiter, these were described as "Fish Balls".  This is considered ASSORTED SEAFOOD?  Really?!!

We asked for the manager to discuss the total mis-representation of this dish.  Fish Balls count as assorted seafood.  

He offered a minor discount, but should have just comped the entire dish.  We were too disgusted and disturbed to argue and continue a pointless conversation.

Don't go here.  There are better options.

This is a solid 3 star restaurant judging from our one and only experience here.

FOOD. We ordered the BBQ pork over rice and the beef chow fun. The BBQ pork was so-so, mostly because there was a strong spice in there that isn't in most BBQ pork rice dishes I've consumed in my life (I have had many, even in Hong Kong). Still, it was edible and all fine. The beef chow fun was the same experience... Ok / not great, pretty salty but still pretty edible.

SERVICE. Good actually! They checked in fairly often to see how everything was and if we needed anything else. No complaints. If anything, my only complaint was for the table beside us - Chinese mainlanders with a kid who was watching his iPad movie on FULL BLAST. So. Annoyed. 

The restaurant itself is well maintained. Felt clean, updated, etc.

This place was extremely quiet when we arrived. It was around 3pmish....so, in between the lunch and dinner rush. Even with only a few people here, our server took forever to take our order. Which was odd. She would just be walking around. Finally, a different lady came over and asked if we wanted to order....uh, yeah! Dont get me wrong, the servers were friendly. Just slow. 

Anyhow, I ordered the sweet and sour chicken and hubby ordered fried rice with shrimp, chicken, and beef. Not much to say. The flavor was bland. Nothing to get excited about. For the Mandalay Bay, kind of surprising this restaurant would just be so so. 

Long story short, will go somewhere else next time.

I'll give it 2 stars because the good was alright but definitely not worth the price. Seriously? $30 for a standard plate of noodles? And also the waitress had no idea what she was doing when billing our room and took forever for us to get out of there but not before asking if we were going to be taking a box for leftovers (my daughter couldn't finish all of her orange chicken) which we replied yes. She then ended up taking her food, which was roughly half a plate, and threw it away. Not worth the price.

Would we ever eat here if it wasn't for the comp that comes with our stays?  Probably not.  Food tastes okay, but nothing tastes great for the prices they charge.  And this surely isn't Chinatown in LA.

Garlic shrimp, chicken & beef was a little sweeter than I would've liked.  But nice serving portion for two.  The shrimp wonton noodle soup was more bland than I'd like, but plenty of noodles and something like 6-8 (big) wontons, so hey, that's a definitely plus.  The calamari we probably wouldn't get again.  Cooked for too long as they were very chewy/rubbery, and the garlic salt & pepper didn't really cling on like the way it does when you order it from a 'legit' restaurant.

Service is okay.  Our drinks were refilled and nothing landed on the table cold, but then again we were wrapping up just as they started seating the ocean of people who were coming out of UFC 143, so I can't speak for how they are when they're busy. 

That food with two sodas cost us just a little over $55, including tax & tip, so not bad for 'hotel' food for two, but again, without the comp, we wouldn't be eating here.  I wouldn't recommend this place either.  I'll definitely take the Dragon Noodle Co (?) at Monte Carlo over this place (that one has combo dinners/specials for 2+ people with bigger portions, more choices & better food).

I don't know where the negativity is coming from. 
I loved my chicken chow mein, and my husband loved his chicken pad Thai. We also shared the BBQ Pork Buns, and OMG they were soooo good!!

The service was on point too, waters were refilled constantly, and plates removed after finishing our meal.

I would definitely recommend this eater-y!!

Definitely nothing to write home about with this place... so I'll write it here.  My group of friends (myself included) were NOT impressed with this place at all.  It was expensive and didn't seem like much food was brought to the table.

One of my friends became ill after eating here, and I think Asian fast food tastes better than what was served here.

This place is so bad. The servers were snotty when I asked for coffee, he  said " we are a Chinese restaurant, no we don't have coffee" umm funny because every other Chinese restaurant has it. No big deal. Then we waited a good ten minutes just to order. When my boyfriend asked the server if they had crab Rangoon's the waitress snickered and said no. It's not nice to be rude. If the answers are no then fine but snarky comments and snottiness need not be applied when we are spending our money!! Right then I knew we should have left but we were hungry and already went this far. Then the food arrives. My boyfriend ordered the Spivey pad Thai, I  had vegetable stir fry. I added the chicken which was an extra $8!!!! Our food was so bland. I never add spice but this needed something. The flavor was completely missing. This restaurant is the worst Chinese food place I've ever been to in Vegas. You'd think Mandalay would have removed them and not renew the lease by now. It doesn't belong in Mandalay much less any where else in Vegas really. Rude staff, terribly long wait to actually be served, and horrible food. Way over priced for the quality. Do yourself a favor and go to one of many other places inside Mandalay, you'll thank me later. I wished I would have checked yelp before coming here.

I've been coming here for several years. Service is consistently inconsistent. Today's waiter seemed angry. Food is usually good (not excellent) but if you need a quick meal between conference sessions this is a good place to go.

The worst place I have eaten in a five star hotel, we went to eat after the Michael Jackson show, we didn't have that many options since it was pretty late and most places were closed or about to close, we tried this place since it looked nice and the menu seemed appetizing but we were very wrong bad bad choice, we paid $21 for a seafood pho that tasted so bad that we couldn't eat it, nothing our party of seven ordered was even decent to eat.
Great food and service. Convenient hours for late night dining!
I realize this has bad reviews but we went there last night and it was wonderful.  The staff was funny and helpful. Food tasted great for the price. I would definitely go back.

read karen's review. 

I'm the guy who wanted to throw up.

My mom, aunt and i were in a hurry to find something to eat so we can go catch our Lion King show in 30 mins! We went in and were greeted by a really nice lady who gave us our menu, our waitress came and asked us if we wanted something to drink and my aunt was like "I'm sorry but we're in a hurry and we're hungry so we were wondering if  we can order the shrimp fried rice and the tom yum soup, and if you can make it really quick?" and she was like "Of course! so she put in the order came back and was like "would you like to pay now since i can take it and get everything done for you so you can eat and go?" 

and my aunt was like "that would be awesome!" and guess what...the food came in i swear 5 mins super fast! The fried rice was okay...there are better places and the soup was eh...could have been better. We ate like we were in the military or something...thats what my mom said lol

would we go here again? Maybe when we're in a hurry like that hahahah

My boyfriend was hungover and I was craving a soup like dish. He ordered their PHO which was mediocre for how much it costed. But lets be real, it's the strip and Mandalay Bay. It's like trying to get Costco price alcohol on the strip. Not happening. :/ I ordered their PORRIDGE w/ the black egg ("thousand year old egg"). I enjoyed my dish, but agree with my boyfriend. The cost of eating there was a bit more expensive, but we were in dire need of some soup based meals!!! Aside from the cost of the food the service was still really good. ENJOY!

I was there in January of this year with my sister.  We both had the Shrimp, BBQ Pork, Scallop, Sea Bass, and Won Ton Soup with the added noodles.  It was really good.  I think it was about $25 which is pricey but considering what we got in it-understandable.
Service was fine-not like Chinese restaurants in Hawaii where they are almost mean to the customers!  Haha.
I'm wondering if the bad reviews are more for the entree type dishes.  My sister and I had no problem with our saimin/noodle dishes or the service.

We only walked in because nothing else was open at 11:30pm on a Saturday night. We sat down to a sticky table, the lady handed us some wet straws. We ordered the calamari appetizer and the Mongolian beef which were both way under Panda Express level. The Mongolian beef was drenched in sauce, and the calamari came out after we finished our dinner entree. This place is horrible, SAVE YOURSELF THE TRIP AND DONT GO. Order some room service instead. And it was expensive for what it was, paid $40 for this unpleasant meal.

Decent quality noodle soups here, but docked 2 stars on the value proposition.  What goes for $13-$15 here, can be had for maybe $7 in Chinatown.  2x for the Mandalay Bay premium seems a bit high.  This place used to be more of a cheap eats business, but has since changed.

Extremely disappointed! I waited over 20 minutes for the worst, overpriced meal I had in a long time.  My takeout order was the roasted duck with rice.  A pretty basic choice -the duck was over cooked and salty.  

The meal seasoning must have been all MSG, because my entire body started itching  & developed hives.

If Maladay Resort was smart it shut it down.  Foolish of me for not reading the reviews first.
Good hangover food at the Manday Bay Resort.  The duck and noodle soup ain't bad.  Kimchi was average at best.

The 2nd star is for being open so late. The food is overpriced and not good at all. Meats were fatty and too well done. The shu Mai was not edible.   To further annoy me, not only were all the BBQ meats fatty and too tough to eat, when I was starving, but I was asked when I ordered if I would like rice with it?  I assumed in typical Chinese restaurant style this meant it came with it so I said yes and was then charged $4.25 for it. 
Are you kidding me?
The shrimp dumplings were the only thing that was good. 
I would never ever again come here for this overpriced terrible food.

Yuck, Yuck, Yuck!

The name is Noodle Shop, yet their noodle soup is probably THE worst on the strip or in the entire Vegas.  AND probably the most expensive too!  If you are stuck in Mandalay and you must have a bowl of noodle or you will die - still, don't go there. Just pick up a hamburger and go to bed.  Yes, it is that bad!
Very good food and service. Fairly authentic. Fast, tasty and economical. I would recommend if you are craving Chinese food.

I wish I read the reviews 1st - before dinning here! 

It said 2 stars - that's accurate! 
How do you mess up Pad Thai!? 
Sauce was off / noddles were egg noodles, not rice :/ 

2 stars for clean / good service
1 star for food
Good food decent price only complaint lettuce wraps made with romaine everything kept falling out but the taste was really good.

Never come here. The food is terrible. We ordered the chicken wraps and didn't even know what it consisted of it looked and tasted horrible. Ordered the chicken satay and yuck that was bad too. We ordered the veggie spring rolls that were super mushy in the middle and probably only tasted decent because they were fried. They need help in the kitchen.

This place was very bad I ordered chicken chowmein it tasted like they used oriental ramen powder  and soy sauce.  The green onion pancakes tasted like they were frozen. My wife dish was god awful the veggies tasted like they were canned and the sauce was bland. Service was very lacking. Don't eat here

Not that good period over battered calamari , oily food and I would tell you what I really think if it was not comp'd.... wish they make this into a great Chinese food establishment , such a great culinary history to pull from and we get this

Came here after checking in at the Mandalay late on Friday.

To be honest, this place was okay, but I'll give it 3 stars cuz the service was pretty damn good. 

I ordered wonton noodle soup. Not bad, not awesome. Big portion, just pretty average in taste.

BF ordered singapore style curry noodles. They were okay as well, nothing spectacular. I guess if you are hungry and it's late and you dont want to go to the Bellagio for their bomb ass noodle shop, then this is a good option.

We had the duck summer rolls to start. BLECH!! Just gross and hard and not worth it. Also had the shrimp shumai. Eh.. they were ok. Overall, this place was just ok.

I was nervous I couldn't order anything here that was vegan but there were actually quite a few options. I ordered the mixed vegetable stir fry and it was amazing! Had it over rice and added a little soy sauce. It was super good! Pretty big portion so it's good for 2 people to share.

If you're reading this and haven't sat down to eat yet, turn around and leave now. My husband and I have been to Vegas several times, and rarely have a bad meal. This trip we were here three days and this was the only "meh" meal we had (serves me right for not looking up reviews before we sat down.) 

We ate here out of convenience - needed a place before the Michael Jackson Cirque show (which is amazing, btw). All the reviews for this place are true. The food is mediocre at best - on par with food court Asian at triple the cost. Service was not good. 

All in all, it wasn't the worst dining experience ever, but it's expensive not good food with lackluster service. Skip it.
A little surprised by the negatives on Yelp.  It's a solid 4 star.  Great for a lunch or brunch.

Restaurants are a hit and miss and if you truly only rely on reviews to dine at a place, you might have missed out on a lot of good places. Then again, everyone's food preference is different. What may be tasty to you might not appeal to everyone and vice versa. 

Based on Yelp, this Noodle Shop is rated poorly, two stars in fact and I'm glad I didn't refer to Yelp before deciding to dine here. Some places has been overrated and in this case, underrated. Probably have CES to thanks too, since everyone is just super busy and just trying to grab a quick meal before hitting the convention halls. 

This is my 2nd time dining here since I got in for CES. Tried a total of 3 dishes: 

Noodles 8/10- The broth is tasty, thick and flavorful. I opted for the thick broth(hot and sour soup broth). Noodles were perfect, exactly how I wanted it to be and not over cooked. The Chili on the side is nice and compliments the dishes. 

Fried rice 9.5/10- I'm not a fan of soft, gooey, sticky fried rice. I love my rice "separated" in individual grains and still have that texture to every bite. This place serves the perfect Asian fried rice. 

Vegetarian fried rice $13
Shrimp fried rice $16 

Price point is not that bad considering this is Mandalay Bay and Vegas! Would I come back, of cos!

If you like MSG, come to the noodle shop in Mandalay bay to get your $15 a pop wonton soup.  

While the service was impeccable and the waiters and waitresses were running around with their cute little Chinese restaurant accents (I am almost certain people do not talk like this normally - the Chinese accent for restaurants is totally romanticized.  i.e. I know plenty of Chinese people with terrible accents and enunciate on all the wrong harsh syllables.)

Anyway, I can't believe we paid almost $30 for 2 bowls of MSG noodles.  It's straight robbery, I tell you.  I'd probably do it again, if I was stuck in Mandalay bay and hungover.

I have been here two time and the foods was way over priced for what you got and tasted awful. I don't want to go into much detail because someone flagged my last review of this place, so this is my nice attempt to warn others not to eat here.

What will you pay for Asian food when you don't want to leave mandalay bay and you have a hangover?  This is the place!!

Not bad congee and onion pancakes. Vegetable dish was a little over cooked.

Expensive and bland!
My grandma always has to get her soup on when she gambles, so we came here and good lorddddddddd... I am better off eating Cup O Noodles in my room, which are so much more flavorful!  The staff could use some flavor too!  Everyone had this look on their face!  Maybe their coworker just passed away, and if that is the case, then I take back what I said, but if not, then based on their facial expressions, this is what they say about Noodle: "Don't come eat this pathetic excuse of an Asian restaurant."
I know it is Vegas, so it will be generic tasting.  I'll give them a star for trying and another for their wide range of Asian dishes.

Had the shrimp wonton noodle soup. Overall it was average and overpriced. You are in Vegas and in a casino so the price was expected. If you're use to Chinatown authentic soup, this would not be the place.

Located in the Madalay Bay, this place is pricey for what it is.  Having a restaurant.com gift certificate definitely helped though, so I recommend that.

My friend had the pork dumplings.  There were only 4 but he said they were very good.  The Tom Yum soup was good as well.  

For entrees we had the mongolian beef and szechuan shrimp.  Good, but the place is pretty expensive so it should be good.  It's decent and so I may go back.

Since my son wanted some Asian food and this place is just downstairs we had to give it a try. We had BBq pork -roast duck combo. Fried rice.
All we good  also my son had the wor won ton soup.  As with every one else I think it was pricey for the type of food.  What I don't understand is 
if the food is blah why is it so dang busy.  The 1st time we ate there we were greeted and seated within minutes.  The 2nd time we ate there yes we ate there twice. The was a wait for about 15 minutes or so before we got in.  The waiter were ok although they do tend to forget about once they serve your food.  Over all experience 2 stars If I only knew there was a Panda express across the street you'll be better off eating there.
By far the worse noodle pla I've ever been too...I would of rather paid $20 for a Cup O Noodles....Save Yourself, and Walk Away
Got the Tonkatsu Ramen. Didn't really care for it. Also my noodles looked like they were just dumped into the soup frozen. I could literally pick up all of the noodles at once.

It's easy to find and centrally located in the casino.  It's fairly large with plenty of seating, cute asian themed decor and seems deceptively nice.  But . . .  it is a disappointing lunch spot.

Firstly or waitress was hard to be found when needed, slow, not very friendly and overall not horrible but not good either.  We had to ask other staff in a nearly empty restaurant to help us.

The food.  Well I ordered the pad thai, it's a fair amount of bland food.  It just didn't have a lot of flavor, from the chicken to the noodles - nothing.  The peanuts were the only saving grace of the dish.  I also shared a pairing of meats including ribs and duck.  The duck was a little dry but fairly good.  The ribs though good hardly had enough meat.  So it was pretty ok.  The white rice was good . . . .

Of course it's expensive, it's Vegas but the quality of food and service did not match the prices.
Had the BBQ Pork Noodles.  VERY good.

Got the duck noodle soup and the wonton noodle soup.  Duck noodle soup is really greasy from the duck.  Shrimp wonton is not bad when my tummy is not feeling well.  Soup base is just right.  The down size is completely over priced.  Each bowl cost $17-$19.  It's nice to seat and eat a hot soup in an AC room.

When you're at a hotel, your choices for any type of food are usually limited. At Mandalay Bay, this Chinese restaurant doesn't disappoint...until you see the bill.

The beef chow fun was great and the won ton noodles were exactly what you'd expect from a Chinese place. The menu is fairly large with plenty to choose from. The food is tasty without the MSG overload of most Asian places. 

Overall, the quality seems fresh and the service is thankfully prompt and friendly. Everything is on the pricier side so be prepared or head to one of the many Chinese restaurants along Spring Mountain Road.

Disappointing flavorles & soupy pad tha with an off tasting filet of chicken sliced into.
I should have complained to the management to get a free meal comp for another Mandalay Bay  I think this was the worst pad that ever, boxed is better!

Needed to spend a resort credit and no options were appealing.  We decided on this place and I found it to be adequate, but much too expensive for either the portions or the quality.  The pork buns were good, but at $12 for three they were way overpriced.  The vegetable curry I had was not very spicy, was heavy on the eggplant, and was only ok.  The best thing we ordered was sweet and sour chicken, but it was't much better than panda express and sure cost a lot more!  Wish I would have consulted yelp! before checking this place out.  One plus was that the service was friendly.
Panda Express is god compared to this place. Grossssssssssss

We ordered 3 dishes.
Crispy Calamari for an appetizer.
Then, Orange Chicken & Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles w/ Sea Food.
 Crispy Calamari was oily rather than crispy in texture. I did not like the dipping sauce at all, too sweet for me. 
It could have been sweet & sour sauce...try adding the hot sauce.
Orange Chicken was missing orange flavor. It was strong garlic and soy sauce flavors. Rice was on dry side...
Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles w/ Sea Food was tasty. It was over $50 just for food...

What a big disappointment.  The restaurant has the atmosphere of a McDonalds and besides the Chinese lanters overhead has no Asian flavor whatsoever.  Appetizers arrived before main courses and the food was mediocre at best.  I was positive that I'd been here 2-3 years ago and I'm sure I was at some version of the restaurant then but it looks like it moved and is now located in an annex of the cafe next door.  Funny how a bad atmosphere can make a meal feel cheap and that's what's happening at Mandalay Bay's Noodle Shop.

My boyfriend and I went here because of my boyfriend's sister suggestion that this place has the best noodle soup. First thing, we just sit at our table for almost 15mins and no one pay attention to us even just water. Later, a lady came to our table to ask us about what kind of drink we want, unfortunately she just served drink not food. The water is awful, tap water....finally, we got our foods "Shrimp and poor won ton noodles soup" and "Roast duck wonton noodles soup w/o roast duck" and these are exactly one of the worse soup I have ever eaten.....never be back or recommend to anyone....

Definitely underwhelming. The only redeeming dish was the egg rolls, which were better than average. Everything else was bland and beige. The Hong Kong noodle dish was ok, but not very flavorful, and the pad Thai was very bland. The BBQ pork steamed buns were interesting, but didn't have much flavor, and the texture of the pork was weird. The service was fine, but a bit curt. We wouldn't spend money on this again - you can probably get better food in any food court.

One thing I found it interesting is, you paid arms and legs in these kind of hotel restaurant, but the food doesn't taste good at all. 

We came here on Christmas day. The service is not very good. 20 min wait with tons of empty table. 

Okay. It is a holiday. I am not going to complain. But after we sat down, it took so long for someone to serve us. That is ridiculous. 

The food, is well kind of bad. It is eatable. But doesn't taste good at all. If you have a car, it is really better to go out and eat. 

Finally, the price... Too expensive !!!! It costs us over $30 per person. If you are not hungry for asian food, you may find a better place to eat in this hotel.

I was in town for work and we had a lunch break, my coworkers and I only had limited time to grab something to eat before getting back to work. We weren't able to check this place out last year when we came here, so there was no line this time and we were able to get seated pretty quickly.

Place looks nice, tables for small or large groups, nice booths etc. Menu had some good selections and a lot of items to choose from.  

I wasn't super hungry so I was thinking I could get an appetizer or two instead of an entree. I noticed they had some appetizers and a small dim sum selection on their menu so I went with that. I got the Chinese BBQ Pork Bao and some steamed shrimp dumplings.  

Pretty weak in my opinion. The BBQ Pork Bao I got was pretty average to below average, the BBQ was probably a day old and reheated, a little dry, steamed buns were a bit mushy and sticky so it was tough to stuff it when making your little sandwich. Comes with thinly sliced pickled cucumbers and some hoisin sauce.  Real basic looking, nothing fancy whatsoever at a high price. I didn't finish it.  

The steamed dim sum shrimp dumplings (har gao) came last even after my coworker's lunch entrees were served, for some reason they said it takes longer because they have to steam it.  Uhhh....sure, ok. Not much flavor, skin was a bit gummy, the dumpling skin comes off easily, I added quite a bit of soy and hot sauce to it to give it some life.... it was mehhh.  

My coworker's ordered some entree dishes like Kung Pao Chicken, I got a few bites because we close like that, good sized meal but at a high price, not the best cuts of chicken, not the most flavorful, it was just ok.  

Service was fine, pretty attentive, but the food just wasn't all that at that high price. We've been to most of the restaurants at Mandalay and most of them are real good but this place we will probably pass on. We were in and out of there in about 40 mins, so I had some time to stop by the roulette table before our work meeting, so that was a good thing.

The service was good and the wait staff was very friendly. The food came out quickly, and the ambience was nice. I was disappointed in the food, everything seemed very bland. We ordered orange chicken, vegetable fried rice, and bbq pork chow mein. I ended up adding chili sauce to the chow mein which helped give it some flavor. The best thing was probably the sauce on the orange chicken. I don't think I would come back, but it's a decent non-food court option in a pinch.

Horribly slow service. Our waiter maybe came around to our table once and when we asked a woman passing by for an extra bowl of rice I don't even think she understood. I found a lot of their noodles were oily and over sauced. Although my chow mein was good (generic) my friend did not enjoy his pad thai and said it made him want to throw up later.

I grew up eating congee in the most dirtiest of places in Chinatown in Manila.  Those have always been good.  

I'm a bit skeptical about the congee here at The Noodle Shop, (just because my surroundings are actually clean looking) but I've got such a serious craving for congee when I woke up and I wasn't having anything else.

Since we were staying at Mandalay Bay, it was convenient to eat lunch here.  I ordered the thousand egg and shredded pork congee ($10.50)  I had to season my soup with soy sauce but the pork itself is already salty. I like the big chunks of egg in there.  Bf had the wonton noodle soup, it was tasteless and for $14 wasn't really worth the money.

Our server was looking distressed from the many tables she was attending.  I thought she forgot about us, but she did manage to throw out a "how's everything??" , just as I was about to look up and respond, she was gone. 

Disinterested server and mediocre food.  A skip.
Broth bland. Everything we ordered is salty (jook, gong chow lau ho, won ton noodle). Overpriced. Poor quality food. Service was nice. Atmosphere is nice.

Overpriced and tasteless. Do not waste your money. The main dishes here had no taste. I think the chef was asleep. My family was totally disappointed. By far, the worst meal we had in Vegas. I would have enjoyed Burger King.

As with everything in Vegas, it was way too expensive here for what it was.
We ordered the dim sum smapler for two. One person could've ate it by themselves. The pieces were very tiny and it was just okay.
We also ordered the Hong Kong style pan fried noodles with beef and it was just okay. Nothing that I need to come back here for. 
Very underwhelmed with the place.

Meal started off ok with yummy egg rolls, however both my friend and my meals were not good especially for the price.

The chicken and vegetables had no flavor, was served in a runny sauce and the vegetables were undercooked.

The seafood soup also had no flavor. Even the rice was bad. How do you mess up white rice!!

Very below par good for the high prices. Will not return

Lunch was actually really good.  It was at the Mandalay Bay.  I had the Hong Kong style crispy noodle with beef.  Lots of tender beef with mushrooms.  Salty base, hard to eat as soup.  The noodles were awesome and the beef very tender.  I think a few too many snow peas.   I could of had a little more beef.  Dish overall was a winner.  Staff was helpful.  Overall I recommend

Hmmm The Noodle Shop. Me and the girls wanted something cheap and easy, and we didn't feel like going off the strip. So we went to old relible which is The Noodle Shop. We each order the same thing which was Kung Pao Chicken. (I know lame but hey) I ordered my extra spicy and they did not let me down. I swear we each had so much food but as hungry as we were, it was well worth it. Service was a little off but considering we were not in a hurry and had no where to be, it was quite ok.

If you are ever in Vegas and staying at the Mandalay Bay, stop over to The Noodle Shop. Yes the reviews are all over the place but you just may be pleasantly surprised.
There is no flavor in the food. The noodle tastes so weird and even worse than instant noodle. It has the worst wonton noodle I've ever tasted.

I think this place deserves a higher than 2 stars for several reasons...

1. People are complaining that this place is expensive. Yes, you are in Vegas! It's like a giant airport, just expect to pay at a minimum double what you normally would for everything.

2. This place adds some variety. There's so many places that are just cafes/pizza places.

3. Their noodle soups are good. 

The beef brisket soup was good and so was their wonton soup! Just don't venture far from the Chinese noodle soups. (I saw someone getting a pad thai there and it looked pretty bad... Also, their pho was mediocre at best...) All in all, my experience was 4-stars especially because this is exactly what my body needed.

Service wasn't great, and the food was also disappointing.  I wanted some Chinese BBQ pork and the texture was a big grindy and there were still some "wildness" in the taste.  The rice was dry and overcooked.

I feel bad for the folks who had not tried asian cuisine before and this place happened to be their 1st time. Worst Pho we have ever tasted. Incredibly bland, aboslutely no flavor. Bad service. And of course everything was overpriced. Such a huge disappointment for a great location.

Same as Annette (it was after my wedding ;D), and while I can't give it 4 full stars, I would totally give it 3.5 if I could.  They sat and dealt with 11 rowdy people with ease.  The prices were ridiculous, but it was a Vegas casino on the strip - it looked about as ridiculous as anything else we were at.

I got the shrimp, noodles, and XO sauce and while I had to add a good deal of chili sauce to spice it up, I thought it was delicious.  I also tried the orange peel beef, the chicken with black bean sauce, and some of the pho broth which was totally yummy.  Everyone I was with liked their food quite a bit!

I'd go here again if the opportunity presented itself - but being that there are so many restaurants in Vegas and I'm only there so often, I don't think I'd make it a priority though.

This was a nice source of comfort food to get ready for an evening of debauchery.  I had a bowl of Pho....actually a HUGE bowl of Pho!  My friend had a bowl of chow mein.  We were thoroughly satisfied with our cuisine.

The server was very attentive, nice, and efficient.  

This restaurant is located in within the cavernous halls of the massive Mandalay Resort.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this overpriced "Asian" establishment. The only reason I had to go here was because someone in my party really wanted Asian food and this was the closest location. 

I ordered the shrimp and pork wonton noodle soup which was not really that good. The broth itself was really bland and the wontons didn't have much flavor either. They were pretty much skimpy with the portions too. I wouldn't even pay more than $10 for this so it stung about my wallet and soul when I had to pay so much for this mediocre dish. 

Overall I do not recommend going here. If you want good and cheap Asian food just get it from Chinatown. There aren't that many good Asian restaurants on the strip so stick with other cuisines in the meantime.
We ordered the fried rice which was very bland had no flavor and we couldn't  find any chicken in our lettuce  wraps. Service was  a little slow but ok.

We thought this place was excellent.  The servers are always moving and very attentive.  We ordered the Kung Pao chicken and beef and shrimp in garlic sauce.  Both were delicious.  Prices were usual for an overpriced resort restaurant.

The Noodle Shop was our meal of choice on the even of the 2013 Chinese New  Year.  Located just off the casino floor in the Mandalay Bay resort, it is designed in a simple, and modern style.

The menu is a mix of Chinese, Thai and other dishes. However, if you are looking for true Thai dishes, this is not going to meet your desires. Lots of rice and noodle dishes, which are great to cure a case of the beer (or wine, or bourbon) flu.  Since I was suffering from a strain of the Guinness-Jameson blight, I chose a hot Green Tea and the Roast Duck noodle soup. This was the perfect cure. The duck was excellent, perfectly cooked, perfectly done meat, with a little bit of fatty skin.  The broth complimented the duck perfectly.  It also had some noodles and a little veg, though I wish there were a little more of the greens added.  My wife  had the Tom Yum Thai soup. Good but not really Thai style, missing elements like the lime and the sour style that is common.  When suffering from the 'flu' it is best to have a spicy dish. The hot bean paste condiment is excellent. Nice roasted and smoky flavor. It does pack a wallop.

The price was right and the service was quick and efficient, and friendly. The General Manager stopped by, asked about our meal and when asked, he gave us a little education on the pending Chinese New Year.  A very nice touch.
Oh no...one word in a nutshell: BLAND!  Located in the Mandalay Bay casino I don't know how this place stays afloat...you're  better off going to Panda express trust me!

I come here to eat roast duck noodle. I always order double meat and the duck can't be fatty. It's always pretty good. One time I forgot to be fussy on my order like I always am. The duck in the soup was disgusting. If you like non fatty duck, don't forget to be fussy when you order your duck soup.

Inside Mandalay Bay, Great environment clean establishement .

I ordered the pork....or was it beef? noodle soup, it was ok , A giant plate of Mexican Clemole would have been better. The coffee was excellent! 

I am not an Asian food expert but I have found Thai food to be my favorite and what ever this was wasnt even close as taste is concerned . It was, hmmmmmm....decent.

Where the hell does a restaurant come off trying to charge $7.95 for kimchi?! My friends and I only ordered due to the convenience factor being that we were staying at Mandalay Bay. Everything on the menu was WAY overpriced for mediocre Chinese food. I'd have gladly went to a restaurant in Spring Mountain if we were mobile, but with the outrageous prices I would have forked over the cab money in retrospect. I think I was really grumpy that night due to lack of sleep (Vegas...), but things started off poorly after it took almost 15 minutes to get the beer we ordered. I'd talk about the food, but really it's nothing to really write about.

I should start out by saying that I live in NYC so I have several Chinatowns near me and have high expectations of chinese food.  That being said, the food was good but not great.  The main issue is the food was never hot.  I did go twice but only because I really wanted to try the Seafood Pan fried Noodles. I wasnt thrilled with it.  

The first day, I had the lunch special of chicken, shrimp and beef with garlic sauce and 2 mini spring rolls (the app should have been served earlier than the main and it was not, so tell them if you want it that way).  That dish was excellent and had it been hot, it would have been stellar.  It came with white rice.  The lunch special is 18.99 and they have about 8 choices of specials; my dish was enough for 2.  Service was slow the first day and quick the second day. My water was refilled constantly and the waiters were very nice as was the Maitre D.  It is a casual restaurant located right off the casino so there is some people watching to be done if you get a table closer to the front.  

I would recommend the restaurant for the chicken, beef, and shrimp dish but not for the pan fried noodles. I also would be specific and ask for very hot food and apps served first. None of these requests should be needed but if done, this review would have been markedly higher.

Wow.  This is awful.  Why did I not check the Yelp reviews first?  Only after eating here did I decide to look.  This was an embarrassment to Chinese cuisine.  Fatty, lukewarm duck that was inedible; gelatinous hot and sour soup; pot stickers with no filling that were obviously frozen; burnt egg rolls with nasty, strange flavors; and a mediocre ramen soup bowl.  Polite service, and they took some of the dishes off the check, but this place is a disaster.  Avoid.

This was our last dinner after relaxing for a few days at Mandalay Bay. We came for an early dinner so we beat the dinner rush. Service was good and our server was efficient. 

We had the pan-fried noodles with chicken, filet mignon with asparagus and an order of the tonkatsu Ramen. The meat entree came with only one small bowl of steamed rice but that was actually more than enough even with me grabbing a few spoonfuls every now and then. 

My hubby's favorite is pan-fried noodles. So when we saw this on the menu we HAD to have it. There was just enough sauce to coat and soften the thin noodles without making it too soggy. The chicken was tender and the veggies were crisp. 

The filet mignon and asparagus was light and delicious. The meat was tender and the asparagus was delicious and seasoned well. 

The girls shared a bowl of Tonkatsu ramen. I wish the noodles were freshly made but it worked. The broth was good and went well with the mushrooms in it. 

In the end, everything was eaten and there wasn't any leftovers. Definitely a good choice for us.

This place was ok! Not nasty but not amazing.
i ate the whole pad Thai dish because I was starving but it was pretty bland and everything felt wet. The chicken was wet and soggy.

Don't know if I would go back...
It's a mystery to me.
The noodle soup I ordered was salty and only had 3 shrimps and a few squids in a so-called seafood Tom yum soup. It was bad and way overpriced. Would never come back

I tried The Noodle Shop when I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a convention and overall I was impressed! There was a decently long line to get in, so I figured the food would be good. Our waitress was not the best, she waited a long time to take our drink orders and some members of our party got the impression she felt inconvenienced and asked for things. I ordered the shrimp fried rice with scallops and chicken, and it was very good, although a little pricey. During our meal, the manager came by and made sure everyone was satisfied with their food. Overall, I was satisfied with the experience and I would be happy to eat here again.

If all my friends get upset stomachs after eating here, expect that you are going to deal with an upset yelper.

Trust me, I don't care so much if I get sick.  But when my friends get sick, THAT is the worst offense.  We couldn't really enjoy the rest of our night because our stomachs felt awful.  However, this is only the beginning of the offenses.

If my friends got sick, I wish at least I could say the food was good. IT WAS NOT! The food was not flavorful and noodles fell flat.  Some of our soups came out lukewarm.

The price of the food here too is completely ridiculous.  I understand that everything is a little overpriced in Vegas but COME ON! You are charging almost $20 dollars for poor quality pho?  You are better off gambling $10 dollars on slots and getting a burger and fries at McDonald's. At least then you would be decently full, maybe make some money, and still have your faculties about you to enjoy the rest of your day.

The one shining star was that the wait staff was super friendly and attentive. Unfortunately, this was not enough to overlook the poor quality and overpriced food here.

Oddly, for all the negative hype of this place, and the ridiculous price tag (and I'm talking ridiculous - I think we paid the same amount here as we did the Border Grill, and that's a signature restaurant while this one is labeled "casual" by Mandalay Bay), the food was actually pretty tasty.  I think the expense has to do solely with the fact that this is Vegas we're talking about - anywhere people can be bilked to fork over change, whether it be for fois gras or a plate of fried rice, it's going to happen.

That all being said, my potstickers and chow fun were tasty and came out of the kitchen hot.  I was satisfied and pleasantly surprised.  If you're stuck in Mandalay Bay and are craving asian, this is fine by mid-level standards.

I ate at the Noodle Shop several times while I was in Vegas. Initially because it had the shortest line but two more times because their menu was extensive and reasonably priced. I had duck last night that was delicious.

I have eaten here a few times over the years when conducting business at the hotel/casino. I have never been disappointed with the soups. I usually order the Wonton Shrimp or the Duck.

There are many awesome Asian restaurants in Las Vegas, away from the strip with great food and decent prices.

I don't see this place as a restaurant locals would go out of their way to go to. They are serving hotel guests, gamblers or show attendees. They probably don't really care about their Yelp reviews as much as a local, non-casino restaurant would.

With that said, I would go back if I was already on the property and wanted soup but I would never go to this place as a destination restaurant.

I agree with other reviews that service here is really odd. We were seated immediately and then sat waiting for quite a while before the hostess came and took our drink order. I requested a Kirin beer, and then what seemed like a very long time later (and we flagged down staff to ask where our drinks were) I was given a carrot juice. Definitely a possibility of a language issue there... but hey, if you like carrot juice, they have it.

We ordered the Hong Kong Noodles and Singapore Noodles. The first was on the bland side while the latter was bursting with flavor. The Dr. the taught me a few tricks of using the provided sauces, spices to enhance the meal. The food was great and you get a lot for your money. We could have easily shared 1 of the noodle plates. 

Still the service needs to improve. As we ate, you could see tables around us also getting slow service and waiting for their bills. I stick with 3 stars based on the quality and quantity of food.

Have roast duck on rice and mandarin braised beef noodle soup. The noodles and the rice part is good but not the meat. My roast duck has distinguishable skin and fat layer, which wasn't that enticing. I would expect a very good bowl of beef noodle soup but the texture of the meat is just too weird. I give an overall 3 start because the service is okay but food doesn't impress me that well.

It's been more than a week since I was here, but having just found the receipt from this restaurant in my wallet I felt it appropriate to warn all tourists to not eat here.

The Mrs. and I ordered soup and noodle entrees (Won Ton and BBQ Pork) which were tasty, but definitely not worth the $17.95 and $12.25 we paid. A few Thai Iced Teas later we were looking at close to $50 for two people eating soup for lunch. I understand the rules of traveling, especially when you go to Las Vegas. You'll normally spend $10 for every mixed drink and $8 for every beer. That's just how it works and it's fine if you get good food and great service, but that's not what we got.

I'm not sure if it was how we looked or dressed but our server "Wendy" was rushing us the entire time. She kept checking to see if we were done with our soup and kept peaking from behind the exit to see how much longer we'd be eating. Another server came by and tried to take our bowls when we weren't even done. They didn't even leave us an option for desert as Wendy rushed the bill to our table. For mediocre-good food, this place had poor service. I couldn't understand why they wanted us out so quickly, it's not like this place was busy at 2:51pm on a weekday afternoon. 

In Summary: The food was good, the tea was fine, the prices were inflated and the service was awful. Instead, go to the Chin-Chin restaurant at New York New York Hotel & Casino for amazing Asian food and top notch service with reasonable prices.

Vegas is expensive, but it doesn't justify the price that the 'Noodle shop' is asking!  I can't quite remember, but I think the pho was like $15...  It's just highway robbery!

The place has small portion, and below average taste.    One of the dishes we ordered was the House special fried rice.  The waitress told us it has dry scallop, when the fried rice came we didn't see any.  Toward the end of the plate, then someone found like 3 small strings.

If this place was in Bay area, it would never survived this long  If you must order, the Hong Kong style noodle was decent taste.

This isn't my first time in Vegas so i know things can be expensive. This is, however, the first time we eat here. It's so expensive and the taste is meh. Our steamed flounder was over 35$ and you can see how small it is! It's so crazy! They don't even bother to make the plate looks nice. We are definitely not coming back.

For what is a "go to destination" resort the Noodle Shop disappoints. You can pretty much expect high price, poor service.  If you really want a good "noodle restaurant", venture down to the Golden Noodle at Monte Carlo and get great noodle dishes with much more in terms of value

Overpriced, underseasoned, disappointing.

We spent $55 and got a cup of hot and sour soup, some seaweed salad, singapore curry noodles, noodles with beef and broccoli (it was $3 to add the broccoli), and a coke.

Friend said the soup was good, the seaweed salad was solid - right amount of sweet and sour, good variation in types of seaweed, yum - only downside was it was sort of warm.

Noodle dishes were not good. Singapore noodles were bland and very, very dry. Like sawdust dry. Tasted like they just mixed together rice noodles, curry powder, and oil. No delicious vegetables, just a few slices of onion, a few measly pieces of BBQ pork, and like 6 baby shrimp. Beef noodles were similarly bland, tasting of nothing but soy sauce. Thank goodness we added the broccoli because that's what was picked out and eaten.

Would not eat here again.
mmhmm...except for pre-req overpricing on every food item, it was delish and not msg-y.

Best chinese food ever in my life 

The real Chinese food for Asians!??????????????????????

Absolute Assault on Otherwise Innocent Food!!!!!

What more, beyond the title, can I say?  The menu is unimaginative, especially for Vegas, and the food execution lacks depth of flavor and attention to protein temperature.  Every single dish (eight in total) was over cooked and underneath that failure of temperature was an embarrassing selection of D-grade meats.

Not even the poor choice of sake is worth the calorie consumption.  

Vegas opened a new Taco Bell with a DJ!!!!  Settle for that.

Expensive for Pho. Worst Pho I've had to date...I wanted to eat all of it because Iwas paying so much for it, but I couldn't stand it any more...I ended up leaving my bowl 1/3 full. I ate at Viet Noodle on West Spring Mountain the other day for less than half the price of this Pho and it was some of rhe best Pho I have had in Las Vegas. The lettuce wraps were sub-par. P.F. Chang's lettuce wraps are much better...and less expensive. Service was quick and decent. Though, the restaurant wasn't very busy at 8:30 on a Monday night.

The one star is way too much for this place , the most horrid food I have ever had .. Panda Express is fine dining compared to this. I ordered calamari to start and cashew chicken for my entre , the cashew chicken came first and it was really not edible , I never in my life had to spit food out until I tasted this sh....,  I really think this chicken was really old and had gone bad , it had a funky taste  and not in a good way ,, then my appetizer arrived and it was so bad I. Really couldn't get my self to eat beyond 2 bits.... How is this place in business ??? Why ???

Worst Asian food I've ever eaten. Stopped in because we were in the mood for noodles. Had the chicken Hong Kong noodles and lo mai gai. The restaurant smelled like a bad fart. The noodles were similar to uncooked ramen, and were covered in a thick cornstarch like Chinese goop. We knew it was going to be terrible when we realized you could get pad Thai, pho, and Steamed pork buns all at the same place. The lo mai gai took forever, and surprise-- smelled like a fart when opened. I would eat it normally only if it was the only thing available. I saw a sad lonely man at one table and two old white ladies sitting together, not knowing any better. Perfect for them I suppose. Literally the worst food I've eaten in years. Avoid at all costs, there is great Asian food everywhere but here.

We came here one afternoon, after a morning of heavy drinking by the pool. We ordered a fried rice dish and something with duck. The service was very quick, the atmosphere was very nice and the food was delicious. It helped sober me up enough for the evening and was definitely the best food quality and portion size to price ratio we found in Vegas. 

The place was almost completely empty while we were there, maybe that's why things were better than other reviewers are reporting, but for whatever reason, I had a very nice experience there and would go back if I were staying at Mandalay Bay again.
The food here is just not good. I had the Singapore noodles and they were the worst I've ever had. Stay away.

The food is way overpriced for the quality. We had spring rolls-more greasy than most and soggy in the middle. My pad thai tasted nothing like pad thai-just grease and a cheap sauce, no flavor. My husband had the house fried rice and it was steamed rice with a few veggies and cold shrimp. He had a coffee and I had green tea. Our bill was $60. Nothing was good. We will never eat there again.

This is more of a 2.5 star review. The only hit was the hot and sour soup which is one of the better ones I've tasted. However we were disappointed with the ma po tofu and the chow mein.... both were almost cold...definitely not cooked fresh. Even though the service was good, when we ordered the ma po tofu the waitress said "oh that is spicy!" As if these gringos can't handle the heat! This made me excited that this might be an authentic Chinese dish. Much to my surprise it had hardly any spice at all! Wine is overpriced. Dining here made L'atelier Joel Robuchon the night before look like a pretty good deal!

I could give no stars if it were an option. My husband and I stay at Mandalay Bay frequently, and end up eating in some of the newer restaurants since the renovation. My husband LOVES noodles, ramen, udon everything... Ordered the spare ribs appetizer, they were luke warm, ordered the beef stew for myself that I was told my our waitress was THE BEST. It smelled of fish and was FULL of fat.... had the waitress take it back and ordered something a little easier, Pad Tai Chicken and it was RAW! We ended up leaving, and with the manager not being very surprised at our reaction, I can imagine it happens alot...
Been here twice, always enjoyed it, generous portions, great staff, the beef noodle soup and bbq pork rice was good, my family raves about the Thai Ice Tea!!! A nice spot for some hot noodle soup.

UGHHHHHH! after we ate here we were immediately dying from all of the MSG used in the food...everything was WAY too salty. and its very hard to make congee taste bad but they did...

my husband had the pho and a friend of ours had the pad thai.......both of these were absolutely disgusting!!!!!! Its a cute fast place but the food is absolutely disgusting...
What the.... worst Asian restaurant I have ever been in. Terrible food, terrible time. They poured something odd in the water. Terrible noodles, terrible service. First and last time.

Server Wendy- service 2/10 ( very low China town style )
Food: 2/10 - ( are you sure is Chinese chef at kitchen?? )
Price: 2/10 ( over price )
Portion: 3/10 ( too small )
Coming back ? / you got be kidding
The worst pad thai we have ever had and the waitress just threw food at us and ran off.   They were understaffed and the quality is horrible.

My Boyfriend recommended that we eat at the Noodle Shop since we were already at Mandalay Bay Casino. We ordered a Seafood Wonton soup and a BBQ over rice dish. Wow! The BBQ Pork was so tasteful and perfectly cooked! Its probably the best BBQ Pork I've tasted.  The Customer Service was pretty good! Prices are a bit higher here for Chinese food. One thing I would complain about is the price for tea here. They charge $4.00 a person for hot tea? So we pretty much paid $8.00 for a pot of tea? Thats right! I guess thats the price you have to pay to eat at a Restaurant inside a casino.

Glad I didn't read the reviews before I ate here.  Actually ordered to go twice during our stay.  Ordered only two items and both times my daughter and I were very happy with the food.  The hostess actually recommended these two items. Yes expensive for Chinese food , but isn't everything in Las Vegas expensive? The pork, chives and shrimp dumplings had a solid amount of meat in it with a light dumpling skin.  Only 4 of them but so delicious.  The chow mein was so great especially at 10:30pm at night.  Both hostesses who took my order were very friendly and my food was ready within 10 min.  We got Togo a second time because I knew my daughter wanted it again.  I'd go here again to our next visit to Mandalay bay.

I can't say much about the restaurant or service because we ordered food to go to take it to the pool. 
I got the chicken chow mien and my husband got the shrimp dumplings. Both were really good. The chow mien was flavorful and packed with chicken and veggies. I would order to go again! 
She also gave us waters in to go cups for the pool!

I don't know why this place has such a bad wrap. I have been going here since they opened, which was a long time ago
Tonight I had the shrimp dumplings, hay graw and BBQ pork which were all delish
I also managed to have a Sapporo with sake. I will admit that the price is ridiculous though... Favorite spot so it won't stop me!
The food was good, but the prices were a little steep.  I would skip this place and head to any other restaurant at Mandalay Bay.

If you've ever picked up a piece of gum off the sidewalk, chewed it for awhile, then spit it into someone else's mouth, that's probably the most accurate estimation of this dump's chicken chow mein. The service was unapologetic for how toxic the food tasted. Hot and sour soup was a hidden gem.

My favoring chow mein is Chef Chu's near Mountain View, CA. My next favorite? Noodle Shop in Mandalay Bay!!. Good service, noodles were perfectly cooked and pan fried with just the right amount of spices, vegetables and plenty of white meat chicken. Yummy!!
Great place for vegetarians, no disappointments with any dish ordered over 3 visits ! Highly recommend the green thai curry!!!

Stopped by here to grab something quick after the NKOTB concert and before drinking at LAX, shared an order of beef chow fun.  It was super greasy, we were hungry so we are it all.  After finishing it you can see all the grease that was left on the plate....ick...oh well, don't have plans to eat there again. Just gave it a shot since it was convenient to where we were coming from/ where we were headed.

After a few days in Vegas doing what you do in Vegas -- eat, drink, eat, drink, rinse, repeat -- I wanted something "light": Asian food! In more of a hurry and not really caring we ducked in here for a quick lunch. I really wish we would have tracked down a Pei Wei instead...

The pan seared pork (and shrimp) dumplings were very good, but the Pad Thai shrimp fell short. We weren't quite sure what was going on with it, but as my friend noted, "why is it so orange?" might have been one thing. The shrimp were definitely frozen and beyond small, over cooked, etc.

Stick with the dumplings, steer clear of the Pad Thai shrimp.
Huge portions- must have traditional taste for Chinese-  I hated - hubby said was good- he eats anything-

My daughter and I ate here twice during our stay at Mandalay Bay, despite the bad reviews on here and it was great. We were seated promptly and someone came up to take our drink orders right away. After giving us a couple minutes to study the menu our server came up to take our order. We got the Chicken Chow Mein and the Chinese Broccoli. It only took 10 minutes to arrive before us and it was good. The chow mein was not too greasy and had plenty of flavor and my 5 year old daughter and I are picky about our chow mein. The broccoli was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of oyster sauce. I would eat here again.

Anyone that gives this place more than two stars deserves to have their yelp account taken away. 

Got the cheaper kung pao chicken (14.50 I think) and immediately regretted it. I would pay 5 dollars for that entree. 

Also, the noodles my friend ordered came out in less than 5 minutes. 

I don't know about you but 5 minutes is not a lot of time to cook(reheat) anything. 

The only reason any1 should ever come to this place is when all the other places inside the hotel are closed.

Make sure to plan your day accordingly :)

First of all I want to say that the food was great! Service was attentive. The Restuarant looks small but it's not it's cozy. Now for the price that everyone complains about, seriously everything on the strip is going to be pricey honestly if it's to expensive then stop complaining and go to McDonalds they raise there prices on the strip. When going to a resort in Las Vegas be prepared to spend money!!! Overall service was great and on top of their game, the food quality is great and the entrees were phenomenal. I see bad stars for this Restuarant but honestly it was most likely from people who can't afford  it  and are looking to complain about something. This place was great and I'm definitely coming back

My waitress was very sweet - I appreciated that she mentioned that my dish had peanuts in it, even though that is almost the only thing I'm not allergic to.  Stupid allergies.
Anyway, the space is lovely, if you have your back to the entrance, you might forget you're in a Vegas casino.  
I had the kung pao chicken and it was delicious!!!  $17 delicious?  Probably not.
Came in to get soup to go. Got ignored for 6 minutes, ended up leaving. Probably just as well since the ratings aren't all that great to begin with.

My friend and I ate here for lunch before we were to head out to the Airport. It wasn't something I will rave about forever and a day. But it wasn't bad either.

It hit the spot. I'll take it :) Chicken wasn't over cooked. Sauce was flavorful. It worked quite well in a pinch when we were having a hard time trying to figure out what to do for food before our airport shuttle arrived.

It's ok food. A little better than your normal Chinese but that's all. Service was fast. Portions are normal sized for a Chinese. It's pricey, 70 bucks for 3 but it's normal prices for Vegas. Definitely overpriced.
