The food is too pricy for the quality. Spare ribs were not the best, soup was very plain  and both entrées were loaded with sodium      and were below par.  The staff is friendly and offered good service.  The atmosphere is nice but what good is a pretty cell phone with bad reception and dropped calls? Would never come here again.

We saw the review and were worried. Yet we decided to give a try. Turned out we really liked it! We ordered a fried rice, magnolia filet and a veggie and we were happy about it. It's more like Cantonese style food and the service is pretty good. I'm glad we can have some decent Asian food at Mandalay Bay.

I went here in July 2012 and the service was horrible! The hosts and servers barely spoke English. We asked how big the portions were and our waitress couldn't even tell us, she didn't know. She just said, "order your food, if not enough, order more". Once we got our appetizers, they were extremely small. There was not enough for even two of our five party members to eat. We ordered pad thai, which was actually good but they brought us toppings to put on it and there were jalapeno and habanero. We were not told that there would be such spicy peppers. One of our party members is allergic and did not realize they were the spicy kind. She started choking and had to spit it out. We talked to the manager in the end and she made light of the whole situation. All in all, my biggest concern was the major language barrier and the lack of knowledge of the employees.

Wow really? 

I was way too hungover to check yelp before coming here.  That's the last time I make that mistake.  It was way overpriced and flavorless.  Our group had the wonton soup with noodles.  The broth was like boiled water.  I had the lunch special with mongolian beef and hot and sour soup.  Some special at almost 20 bucks.  Not much beef.  Also there were flies in the restaurant.  I could accept that at a hole in the wall joint not a place inside mandalay. 

PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!

completely overpriced. service is slow. food is moderate.. would not recommend the pho or the preserved egg congee. but I guess if you are trapped in the Mandalay and must have Chinese food (and money is no object).. then consider yourself forewarned.

So the waiter was very nice. The sake was awesome. The sampler platter of cooked dim sum was mediocre and my dinner plate of chicken lo mein was so salty I couldn't finish it. The restaurant was clean but they really need to up their food quality. Definitely not worth the money.
The food at this place is sub par, bland and not worth the money. You are better off going to panda express across the st. I was starving and checked in super late, so I had no choice.
A really sad establishment where servers give zero ****cks and said they only give you forks to eat with and no spoon except tea spoons and giant spoons.

Garbage. Garbage. Garbage. Over priced garbage. They should be embarrassed they are making this food. It's not nice to charge so much and give small portions and garbage tasting food. They were rude as well. ITS OFFICIAL... FOOD SUCKS AT MANDALAY BAY. ROOM SERVICE SUCKS TOO.

Yikes...their standards have dropped yet again from 2 years ago.  I don't care about the price - it's going to be expensive - as another reviewer has mentioned, you're in Vegas.  Seriously.  

However, I ordered a BBQ pork w/ rice dish and the rice was over dry and the BBQ porked lacked any sort of sauce.  I was also given 2 dingy pieces of Chinese broccoli that was way overcooked.  

Overall, it was a very mediocre dinner.  I don't think I'd ever go again.

Wow, where to begin with this place. Only came here because of my brother in-law. He kept saying how great this place was and plus every restaurant there was pack expect this place. I wounded why... So I by pass looking at the tips and reviews that everyone wrote so I can give this place a fair chance.

So soon as we put our name on the list we waited only for about 5 mins. Okay, that is cool place didn't seem so bad. Right? Place look clean, got seat away from everyone else so it was a nice family style of five. Then this is when the stars kept on falling here... We waited for ten mins for the server to get us water and our orders to be put in. We had to flag some manger to get someone to attend to us. 

Now comes the good part dinner. We order fried calamari, pancake, and BBQ pork. Out of the three the BBQ pork was the best. The pancake was too powdery too me. And the calamari it was all batter! Horrible. As for our main course the duck soup with noodles was bland. Shrimp fried rice was okay but lucky for me they had sriracha  the house special noodles was okay but again sriracha is needed again.

To sum it all up, come here for BBQ pork. If you really have too. I mean if you have no where else to go and your super hungry. Other than that if you still have the power to wait else where to eat then go somewhere else. This was not worth the money or time to try.
i was surprised coming here for the second time. I ordered beef noodle soup and it was pretty good.  It is pricy for casual chinese but it is expected.

Oh dear Oh dear. How can you go wrong with chinese broccoli and oyster sauce? Well let me tell you can. And the spring rolls were like little cigars dripping in grease and you could not taste the veggies inside. I won't be back.

I'm not sure why people are so down on this. I would give it 3.5 to 4 stars.

I was these for a convention so I grabbed a quick lunch   I had the shrimp udon with xo sauce. The noodles were very good tender and the portion was large.  The flavor was good not too salty at all.  Lost of onions and scallions which I liked. It was served piping hot.

I also tried the shrimp shumai. They take longer to make. These were a bit tough and over steamed.

The service was very good and attentive.   I definitely preferred this as a reasonable lunch option in a resort that is not the greasy food court.

EXPENSIVE NOODLE SOUP, but boiling hot soup sure does help from a night of hard partying in Vegas. Sure it's 110 degrees outside, but inside the Mandalay it's a cool, crisp 70+ degrees!

I only had the Roasted Pork Egg Noodle Soup and I must say, I LOVED IT. I loved watching the oil sit on the top layer of my soup (HELLO, oil is the cure to a mean hangover in my book).

Oh and I really did want to try the Har Gow but I couldn't justify spending $8.50 on something that usually costs less than $2. 

I'm going back to Vegas in Sept... so I'll be here again. Prices suck, yes.... but it's going to be the same no matter where you go!

We made a big mistake coming here. We were craving Chinese food and this was the only place that we saw open. I ordered a won ton soup and my wife ordered a chicken dish. When we both finished we both came to the same conclusion. The food was the blandest we ever tried. After reading the reviews I realized the mistake we made by walking in here. I highly recommend finding anywhere else to eat.

We came here because it was open late.

1. Hot & sour soup tasted like tomato soup.
2. shrimp and pork wonton noodle soup was delicious.
3, fried rice was ok.
4. Staff was friendly and nice.

Oh Boy, nothing sums it up than the service felt very forced and not very courteous from the hostess who sat us, and yes the server herself. You know that ominous feeling like you're just another digit versus maybe a repeat paying customer? Yes that feeling, like asking to get more menus for all of the people in the party? Isn't that restaurant 101 or were they that short on counting fingers to figure it out! The menu: typical choices you would find at all fast food "Chinese" take out. Flavor: tasted like the typical "Chinese" food from any average casino buffet. I say that because we were staying at Mandalay Bay and went to Bayside Buffet and the "Chinese" items were that much better! We had a fairly big party of 14 people, but there was maybe another 3 little parties in the restaurant the whole time we were there. 6 o'clock Saturday on Easter weekend. This place was empty, the service was lacking, you had to ask for everything (refill, napkins, etc). With a handful of workers just standing on the side wall coming from the kitchen, they should've been more attentive to a big party. The only item that was half decent was the Beef/Broccoli only because it was the only entree that came out like it was made to order and was somewhat hot. Everyone's meals were room temperature or looked undercooked. Everything was BLAND! Makes you wonder who cooks and manages this place in a nice Hotel like this. The second star is because the place was clean, other than that all negative reviews are true about this place. I for one would never recommend it no matter the convenience because you'll be paying the average price of $16-19 an entree, where your average good Chinese restaurant you would pay about half across the board. Service :1
Food:2
Price:1  
You get the picture, avoid, avoid!

If you want the most expensive, least bang for your buck, biggest ripoff of a restaurant you can imagine, come here.  $8 for a bowl of soup (3-4 spoonfuls)?  My Chinese ancestors, preaching a culture of frugality, are rolling over in their graves.  I hate this place for making me feel so unjustified for spending that money...and seeing as that's all you do in Vegas w/ gambling and partying, for the Noodle Shop to be my biggest loss that weekend is just sad.

usually places that serve multiple types of cuisine can't hang, but i actually found the food at the noodle shop to taste just like at back home.  too bad the prices are double what a normal SGV restaurant would charge.  it IS vegas afterall, so you really shouldn't be surprised.  

for the convenience factor of being inside the mandalay bay, and the fact that you can satisfy everyone in your groups craving with choices ranging from won-ton noodle soup to pho, i was pretty satisfied.
The service was great even though she was very busy.  We ordered salt-pepper park and Hong Kong pan fried noodles.  I gave it a 4-star rating because our food came warm not hot.   It was delicious.

Came here for a quick lunch with my parents since we didn't want to leave the hotel. We ordered the chicken lettuce wrap and shrimp fried rice. My dad and brother really enjoyed the the fried rice while the chicken lettuce wrap was just whatever for the price we've had better

Never ever go here.  Really bland overpriced food with horrible service.  

I've had better kung pao chicken out of a frozen bag from Trader Joe's....much better actually.

On our last day in Vegas, everyone wanted to eat something different. As for me, I remember seeing the noodle shop, and having some hot noodle soup or chow mein sounded yummy after drinking all weekend. So, our group headed over to the noodle shop.

First off, the service is really really bad here. The service is slow, and half of the staff doesn't know what they're doing. Granted you don't get good service in a Chinese place, it was still worse than many other places. Our waiter just didn't care about anything, and never came back to ask how our food was or refill our water. On top of that, we wanted to split the bill at the end. So the way we usually do that, is write each person's last 4 digits of their credit card number and the amount they want to have charged on their card. At every restaurant, waiter's are please to see us make it so easy for them, and have it done right away. However, the staff here just couldn't figure it out. We waited a total of 20 minutes just to get our bill back. I noticed that there was about 4 people trying to handle the bill, and none of them could get it, so they finally had the manager come out. After the whopping 20 minutes, we finally got our bill back.

As for the food here, let's just say I much rather go to Panda Express for my Chinese food. I ordered chow mein, and it was soo bland and soo oily and greasy. I can't cook Chinese food for shit, and I could whip something better up.

Overall, I was really disspointed since I was craving some good , or even settle for decent, Chinese food. Good thing I went over to my aunt's house after and she made me some amazing Cantonese food.

We were staying at the Four Seasons in Mandalay Bay and decided to grab a bite before our flight. The menu options look appealing, although overpriced but I made the mistake of not checking Yelp beforehand...

Ordered the Spicy chicken curry and white rice. The chicken had absolutely zero flavor to it. The entire dish was bland with barely a hint of any curry. I added mounds of red chili and soy sauce for added flavor just to make the dish palatable. 

Service was okay, nothing great. Would not return

The food was so whack. My dad and I ordered the wonton noodles and they were very soft, almost like rice noodles instead of a slightly gummy/al dente texture that egg noodles are supposed to have. My dad's coworker ordered pad thai, which was oddly yellow in color, something I've never seen any restaurant make before. They also didn't have any Vietnamese coffee because they were apparently having issues with their supplier or something. The prices are high, but it is what it is being a Vegas hotel restaurant. 

The waiter on the other hand was very friendly and I felt bad for him because it seemed like he was struggling handling the bowls of very hot soups.
Love the Mandalay Bay and this is a nice restaurant, but the noodles weren't awesome.  They could have used more flavor.  Great service though.

I wrote a favorable review for Raffles, and The Noodle Shop is next door...or rather in Raffles or an appendage thereof.  You would think they shared the same kitchen

This is a different review...I did not enjoy my won ton soup with noodles..It was bland and tasteless.  Perhaps, I cant remember enjoying a soup less..and I am happy with Campbells

Yet at the same time, everyone seemed to enjoy their selections:  Fried rice, Orange beef, Marinated chicken, Pad thai, Veggie spring rolls

So what am I saying?  Go to The Noodle Shop except for Noodles?

This place is honestly not all that bad. The rating for the Noodle Shop is probably low just because A) not everything here is tremendous and B) the prices. I get it. The prices are lofty, but the food is homey and comforting.

We decided to get the dim sum sampler, the duck noodle soup, the shrimp dumpling noodle soup, and the sichuan.

The sampler? Probably not worth the $20. You get four different types of dim sum, with 2-3 pieces of each type. Tasty, but it might've been better if it were $10 or so.

Everything else was very good. The duck in the noodle soup was perfectly cooked, the shrimp dumplings were tasty and plump, and both noodle soups had great broths and noodles. The eggplants were especially delicious.

Why a three? Though the food was tasty, I JUST found out that restaurant.com offered a coupon for the Noodle Shop... SO ANGRY RIGHT NOW. Don't make the mistake I made -- retrieve a gift card from restaurant.com before you go here!!!

The food was good, but nothing special. The service was adequate. I had a noodle dish with beef and duck, and the noodles had an unappetizing slimy feel to them. The duck was good, but the portion was very small. They charge $2.50 per person for hot tea, which I thought was a little much, and everything on the menu is $13 or more. For the quality and portion sizes, I'd expect them to charge half the price. On the plus side, the place was cute and well lit and it was easy to forget you were in a casino.

The food here sucks. Everyone in our party had a stomachache after eating here. The pho was disgusting. Instant wonton noodles are better than the stuff they serve at this restaurant. The Mongolian beef was mostly onions and the meat was still raw. Service was not good. One person had to wait 20 minutes for his food after the rest of us got our food. Do not go to this restaurant.
Food was a little bland and plain looking but I'm glad they had soy sauce and I was too hungry to care. Lol

Panda Express has better quality food than this place!  The kung pao chicken has peanuts sprinkles on top of it instead of being cooked in the dish...it looked like someone sprinkled the peanuts straight out of the jar!  Our second dish, was a sad case of Chow Mein.  I wouldn't recommend eating here unless your super drunk and have lots of money to blow.
The only reason that I give one star is about the environment. The dishes here are not good at all. There are either too salty or sweet. Their menu looks quite limted. Not recommend
Should have checked Yelp first. Service was great but food was yucky. Ordered BBQ pork and it was hot, and Kung Pao Chicken and Chow Mein were over sauced. Save your money!
Total disappointment.  36.00 for a piece of fish not even cooked asian or any asian style.  Stay away
The price is very high but the quality of the food is deeply unsatisfying.we ordered Yangzhou fried rice and their special fried rice. They tasted the same. Disappointed.

Yeah ummmm. Totally didn't read the reviews before going in here today, and was expecting a bit more flavor from this place.

Got the roast pork (cha chiu), Chinese broccoli  and steamed rice.  Well, I got it like 35 minutes after I ordered it.....

I was kinda pumped to see they had some of my favorites, but I have to say it was pretty bland.  The cha ciu was not sweet enough, and there was little-to-no brown sauce to add flavor. The Chinese broccoli was blanched properly, and had a drizzling of oyster sauce on it----but that only gives flavor to the lucky broccoli that got the sauce.

Again, if you are in need of a real Chinese fix, this joint isn't the top choice.  Head over to the Spring Mountain Rd area...

I have a soft spot for this place .. it's expensive for what it is but esp when drinking and gambling love this place ! We go every year . Won Ton noodle soup good .. Mabo tofu Chinese broccoli salt and pepper prawns and fried rice yummy and our favs 
When you get your $50 resort credit as a deal use it for here

Don't be fooled by the designer's touch and the great service. You're here for the food and the food is mediocre at best.

Orange Peel Chicken: we asked to substitute chicken for beef. What did they do? Threw a bunch of breaded chicken in a beef sauce. Imagine putting chicken in your mouth and tasting beef.

Kung Pao Chicken was way sour and dulled down.

Cury Crab Potstickers were good.

Overall, a mediocre meal for $60. Keep walking. There are better places at Mandalay Bay.

This was just okay. Nothing we ordered was bad, but it was a bit overpriced. Okay, I know that should not be surprising in Vegas, but the environment was sparsley decorated, no real vibe of any sort at all. Bowls of soup were like $10. I guess I am used to the hard core authentic places that give you awesome food for giveaway prices.  

Wonton soup was fine. Nothing here nor there. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IImZFNzX4cP84rFsyb-9mQ?select=bc-yxdm0IHKl6nonLzfwpw

Seaweed salad was again fine. Standard. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IImZFNzX4cP84rFsyb-9mQ?select=QCkc2BuIX6v5Pq17ia_x1w

Pan Fried Dumplings were good. Nothing great, but good.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IImZFNzX4cP84rFsyb-9mQ?select=Dw-0ZFQtX-biYZj9ZKMAMA

It wasn't very Vegas festy inside. I think maybe if you have a hard core drunk craving for Chinese in your room and are willing to pay more than the usual price, this may be the answer, Otherwise, I wouldn't bother. Too many other cool places in Vegas to experience.

You would think this would be the perfect place to cure a hang over right? ...We were wrong... there was 10 of us and we only had to wait about 15 minutes for them to clear 2 tables for us. Once we were seated, we looked at the menu only to find the prices were pretty freakin nuts for the type of food this place offers. (ie. $20 for pho, $18 for pad thai, $18 for wonton noodle, $26 for wonton, scallop, pork, vegetable soup, $10 eggrolls, $4 for thai ice tea, etc **these aren't the exact prices but its around this price**).

After ordering our food, we had to wait about 15 minutes just to get our drinks. Had to wait another 45 minutes to get our food. I guess they wanted to serve us all at once so half of the food that came out was already cold or room temperature. Onto the food.... ABSOLUTELY the worst chinese/vietnamese/thai food we've ever had. Everything lacked flavor, meats and seafood was chewy, soup tasted water down, portions were kind of small for what you pay for, etc. I work and eat in downtown Oakland China Town all the time, and The Noodle Shop doesn't even compare to anything there.... Pho or wonton noodle soup is my hang over food, and this place just wanted to make me throw everything up.

This place was highly understaffed, and the cooks were slow.... My friends and I have already made complaints, so in the mean time...STAY CLEAR AWAY!!! You're better off walking 5 minutes away to McDonalds!

$18 for a bowl of soup with a 1/2 pound of spagetti noodles, two thin slices of beef, a pinch of basil, a pinch of bean sprouts and a pinch of cilantro with a couple hot peppers.  Maybe it was because it was the end of my four days in Vegas and it gets tiring to be hammered with overpriced food day after day after day, but this was the final straw.

Quicky Review: overpriced basic chinese american dishes. Eat elsware. 

Ate lunch with the family. Do not get the pho. It is extremely bland and the noodle texture is stiff and not chewy. The pho costs double the price compared to back home, it takes 5 times longer to come out, yet it tastes like warm water with noddles. We also ordered orange chicken, mongolian beef, and garlic lobster. All the items were good but way to overpriced for simple dishes. There are so many delicious restaurants at the Mandalay Bay, steer clear of Noodle House

Surprised to like the beef and noodles here, but service was a bit lacking and the food was overpriced.  Convenience was the buying driver in this case since I was staying at THEhotel and attending a convention at Mandalay Bay.  This is a lunch spot...no more.

The worst Chinese food ever.
Wasted $25 for a single serving noodle.
Will never return.

Pei wei reject food at crazy prices. Mixed drink sucked beyond belief, not sure what they put in it. . DO NOT GO!!! Fried rice had no soy sauce. Their were 7 of us, and the food came out 5 minutes after we ordered. Everything is pre-made and it tasted like it.

What a rip off! I  have never been charged 15 bucks for a pot of Chinese tea . They need to state it on the menu.  Also, our dinner costs 70 bucks for a plate of noodles and a bowl of porridge.  I rather buy a cup of noodles.

service was great but the food quality...oh man! the pho i ordered was so tasteless i always finish my pho but could barely choke it down. the beef pieces were too thick...i suggest slicing them on the slicer thinner and if you cant, freeze the beef so that its easier to slice thinly. the pan fried shrimp and chive was good with the sauce. i wish i got the shrimp wonton noodle soup which my friend got. easier to eat.
Pretty good Asian food and I'm an Asian dude. I had the ramen which was tasty and I also tried the calamari, ma po tofu and pad Thai which were all good. The vegetable green curry was meh.

Service at The Noodle Shop was good, our server was very attentive. Servings are family style and the price is reasonable, we had order the typical.

Beef and Broccoli: delicious!!
Fried Rice: bland
Chow Mein: oily and bland

This is probably a repeat of what most yelpers have said already, but this place is way too pricey for the quality of food.  I had the shrimp wonton soup, which wasn't bad, but wasn't mind-blowing either.  I also ordered the lychee martini which tasted like the juice that comes with canned lychee, and that was it, little to no alcohol content.  My sister had the chicken chow mein which she said was a little too salty.  My mother really liked her rice porridge, however, and I had a bite of the pan-seared dumpling that my other sister ordered which I found rather tasty.  Service was super-friendly though, couldn't fault them for that.  Still, I probably won't be returning.

Great location in the Mandalay Bay...great ambience...however, the food is overpriced....and not that great. My friends and I shared Mongolian Beef and Fried Rice...we waited a good 20 minutes before our food arrived and I wasnt very impressed with the food. Had better Chinese food in a mall.....

Yelpers, thank you so much for your reviews because my husband had already redeemed a credit to use at this restaurant.$15 off $50 or more.   After reading your reviews and getting more and more horrified that our dinner is going to be an expensive disappointment, we decided to not order the noodle soups which was the target of most of the bad reviews. Instead we went with the      SEAFOOD STIR-FRY SUPREME
(Lobster, Scallops and Prawns) which we asked to be made spicy and the HOUSE SPECIAL CHOW MEIN (Shrimp, BBQ Pork, Chicken and Onions Wok-Fried with Soy Sauce).   Both turned out to be excellent.   We are both Chinese and believe me, I was ready to give a terrible review but we were pleasantly surprised with the food.  The service was great as well.

**Take out Review**
I hate to go against the grain, but I really enjoyed The Noodle Shop. My husband and I were in need for some comfort food, and for us, that's noodles. We ordered pad thai and Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles and Seafood to go. The staff was helpful and kind, they kept it short and sweet so that we could be on our way. We had to go take care of some business with the concierge and when we got back, our order was waiting for us. 
We took it up to the room and enjoyed our noodles and TV (as God intended). The pad Thai was fantastic, and I am fully aware that it could be because I was starving, but either way, I enjoyed it very much. Mr. R. finished his dish and even had some of mine. I appreciate the Noodle Shop for being different from the other casual fare offered at Mandalay Bay, sometimes you have to take less than desirable noodles in order to get noodles at all.

Drunk or not, the service is terrible. The attitude of Chinatown without the price or the authenticity or flavor. You'd do better at Raffles since the wait would be just as long but at least it's a comfortable setting.

Overpriced, not a friendly atmosphere at all. We ordered the shrimp wonton noodle soup. Soup was good. While ordering the waiter told us the soup was only enough for one person. It was enough for two adults actually. Thank goodness for our two kids we were able to order off the kids menu. We had the chicken fried rice and the chow mein- it was ok. Service is odd. The waiter only brought two soup bowls out when there were 4 of us at the table. The kids menu came with a drink and the staff only wanted to bring out one juice since they brought me a refill on my coke which I didn't ask for. Coke was 4 dollars. We asked them to bring out the two drinks since we had two kids and it came with the meal. At the end we asked for a to go container for the soup and they said they don't have any. So I guess if you order soup you can't take it to go? Weird. We just used our juice cup since the kids enjoyed the noodles and wanted it for later.  They gave us the kids menu which had coloring on it, but they only gave us one menu and  no crayons. 
 Some of the menu items are just outrageously priced. 
 Who pays 16.50 for fried rice and a lot of their single dishes like fish or beef were upwards of 24 dollars and up? 
  My kids did like the soup. The atmosphere and customer service of the staff is definitely lacking.

Over priced Asian food! I get it, it's a vacation spot and they have to price accordingly.

But hey at least make the food decent. I ordered a seafood stir fry with veggies and I think that was around $18 (yikes- really super high)

Thai ice tea was $4.50 - and I didn't order that.

Their Phou soup was priced supper high. I don't have a problem paying vacation prices, but it seriously was not that good. Greasy, salty and unsatisfied...........

Before coming, we read the reviews. We should have listened. However, we were staying in Mandalay Bay and craving warm asian food, so we figured to give it a try- how bad could it be? 

We ordered the fried rice, beef chow run, and dim sum platter. To start off, everything is overpriced, but that is fairly typical on the strip. The fried rice was very bland. The beef chow fun was too salty. Nothing seemed to be going right.

Then, it got worse. We were told the dim sum sample platter for 2 would take 15 min to arrive. It took way longer. It consisted of 8 pieces shumai/ dumplings and 2 pork buns. For $30, I was expecting a bit more. To top it all, everything was disgusting. The dumplings were rubbery and everything else look liked it had been dyed with food coloring. After eating 2 pieces, we couldn't take it anymore and stopped. 

I've never had such a bad asian dining experience before. I didn't expect authentic food at a hotel in vegas, but I definitely never expected to encounter such a dining experience. Ever.

Both my friend and I got sick eatting here over the weekend.  Had a craving for some won ton noodles and I really didnt want to drive or catch a cab to go some place else.  Big mistake.  The broth was warm, the noodles were soggy and the won ton was barely cooked.  It's very expensive by the way.  You are looking at around 14 dollars for a bowl of noodles.  Sam woo in Spring mountain road is better if you are willing to catch a cab out there.  The wok at the mgm is cool too if you want to walk across to MGM.  Hate to say this but if I had to stay at the Mandalay Bay again, i might have to eat there again............I guess I won't be staying at the mandalay bay.........hahahaha.  If you would like to eat at a great authentic chinese restaurant off the strip.........try Joyful House.

Restaurant is overpriced and over rated, for the price that they charge for the food, you would figure that it would be at least decent, especially after a night in vegas. you want to get something good to eat. I found myself taking a cab the next day to Spring Mountain and found some real chinese food, at great prices.

I've been here a hundred million times. Literally.

They have really good food. I used to come here with the casino hosts from the Mandalay Bay, so we never 'did' lines. But, there are lines, there are tons of people who want to be here all the time, and the place is small. 

XO string beans. They have an asparagus thing that is pretty good. Their Pho is so-so. Eggplant is pretty good. Its all good. Its all very very expensive.

I don't understand the bad reviews for thus place. The food and service we received were incredible. I had the kung pao beef fillet medallions. The taste was so good, and the serving size was generous! My husband had the chicken fried rice, and that was so flavorful. Great place to dine!

Everyone in our party said their food was 'good, but different.' The pad Thai was tasty, but orange-colored and more tomatoey than we've experienced. The orange chicken was bland and more crispy than anything. The fried rice rocked! The pho was good, but the beef in it was incorrigible -- tough and had to be cut on a plate, but a nice addition once added.

The service left something to be desired. Nice folks though.

Place sucks for Chinese food, u have been warned!!!
Pretty much everything is tasteless or doesn't taste like it should!

The food is as bad as everyone one says. I only ate here because a friend that was staying at the Mandalay Bay was already here eating & invited us to come over from the Luxor next door and join them. I tried some of the beef bowl & the shrimp noodles, this was some of the blandest food I've ever had in my life. I didn't bother to try anything else they ordered since my friend said it was all pretty bad. Everything turn out pretty pricy too. We had about 3 or 4 orders of food & the bill was over $100.00. We should have just got on the tram to the Excalibar and got pix up stix from the food court.

Every time I have attempted to visit the Noodle Shop restaurant at the Mandalay Bay something has happened which prevented me from going. (E.g., Closed due to remodeling, closed due to water main break, closed due to stars alignment with Jupiter, etc..)  Anyway, I finally had a chance eat at the Noodle Shop and we weren't disappointed.

My daughter Muff, sister Luch and I were exhausted and broke after spending the day at the Fashion Show Mall.  We barely dragged ourselves back to the hotel and decided to eat before we went to our rooms. (We said that if we could make it to our rooms, we were NOT leaving.  And the previously checked out room service menu didn't strike our fancies.)
We perused the menu and here's what we ordered:
*  Shumai, 
*  Singapore-Style Fried Rice Noodles with Shrimp and Pork
*  Shrimp, Beef and Chicken with Garlic Sauce;
*  BBQ Pork with Mixed Vegetables

Only four dishes with rice and enough to feed a family of moose!  Everything was delicately flavored and wonderful.  I love garlic, but it can easily overpower any other flavor in its path.  It was present and accounted for in my Shrimp, Beef and Chicken with Garlic Sauce but not overly so.  My sister's Singapore-Style Fried Rice Noodles with Shrimp and Pork was also delicious.  And my daughter Muff's BBQ Pork with Mixed Vegetables was simple yet enchanting.  And the freshly made Shumai was delightful.
We had a scrumptious lovely meal to end our day of shopping madness.

I liked this place! What better way to nurse your hangover than a big bowl of pho or veggie chow mein? Service was quick  and friendly too.

Prices were a little steep, but this is on par for all other pricing at any of the restaurants in/near the Mandalay Bay.

I recommend it if you don't mind spending $20 on noodles.

This place had 2 stars at the time I ate here, and honestly, it's not that horrible. This is not the best place, but it is digestible. You want 4 or 5 star quality go elsewhere. 

My big complaint however is the price, I get that it's Vegas but 60 bucks for egg rolls, pork buns, a small wonton soup, and pad thai is a joke.

After a long night of partying, we were in desperate need of something warm or hot and comforting. What better cure for a hangover than Pho? We had a group of 12 and the people working there wanted to cram us into 2 TINY ass tables..... Are you kidding me?! We kindly requested to add an additional 3rd table... they gave us this dirty look wow.

Anyway, most of us got Pho, some of us got rice dishes and others some other noodle soup dish. The Pho was like $17?! What in the @#$%!! I anxiously waited for my Pho.... and it came 30 minutes later.... I do not know why it took them so long to slice up some beef, add the hot broth that should already be simmering in a huge pot, and some noodles.

The Pho wasn't even hot!!! It was lukewarm at best!! The beef wasn't even cooking thru!!! The whole bowl had like 4 slices of beef.... no meatballs, no tendons, no tripe. I didn't know you could mess up Pho, but this place did!

Suggestion: Don't come here. Bad and expensive food. Terrible service. Gah I'm still mad... I would've rather bet that money and lose it.

My party was seated very quickly because, well, the place was pretty damn empty. This was on Sunday around lunch time. Fortunately, the food came out quickly too. I ordered the sea bass congee, and it was pretty basic. A few green onions. Small sea bass pieces. No Chinese donut. No century egg. The problem here is the price. For what it is, way too much to recommend. The congee itself was fine but not spectacular enough to justify the price of $17+. Do not plan on coming back, but I do plan on having some better, cheaper congee soon.

Hostess was very friendly.

Great food at reasonable price. 

We got the broccoli oyster and Kung pao chicken.  Other meals were great and service was fantastic and fast. Request server Wai Q and you will not be disappointed (attentive, friendly, fast)

During the meal the manager, older gentlemen, came over twice to quickly ask how things were and continued on. We respect this at all restaurants. 

Would highly recommend eating here.

Even after you read all the reviews and you're thinking to yourself, it can't be that bad... don't go.  

If my friends and I could give this zero stars, we would.  We're not sure we've ever had such a bad experience.  Ever.  

We ordered pad thai and the shrimp and asparagus - both were lackluster and tasted odd...even the plain white rice tasted smoked or burnt.  We couldn't decide.  

Even though it's inside Mandalay Bay, don't be fooled... it's hard to imagine how this place has stayed open as long as it has.  

I know this review is harsh, but it's truthful.  Find another place for dinner.  You'll thank me later.

I've eaten here a few times now and been pretty pleased. I can think of places worth two stars but this is not one of them. The Singapore noodles are great, with generous amounts of shrimp and chicken. The shrimp were not at all fishy. The shrimp dumplings were plump with shrimp and also very nice. The BBQ pork with mixed vegetables was surprisingly good, very nice assortment of vegetables and a flavorful sauce. Service was fine, though the restaurant was not crowded and the lady with the mop should have waited till we left before mopping all around our table. I would go here again next time.
Terrible. The food was bland and low quality. If you're at Mandalay bay and hungry, keep walking. Plenty of good options close by.

Wow, waited 20 minutes for our order to be taken. Then got the food in 8 minutes with days old chicken and horrible noodles. My husband got the chicken fried rice but the rice was not fried. They should have just closed their doors tonight. Everyone was looking around in utter disguised. If you want to eat good Asian food, don't go to the noodle house

Had dim sum sampler for 2, seaweed salad, BBQ pork noodle soup.
It was just a sponteneous lunch at Mandaley. 
Price was not cheap either (we paid about $60).  Will go Chinatown next time.

Just awful. Really really bad. We had dim sum for two. 26$. Thought would be decent amount of food. I am not lying when I say not only was it buffet quality food but tiny portions. The dim sum was ok some BBQ. The rest. Boring plain and no sauce except soy. Just 200% over priced!!!!

Wonton soup. Omg. I LOVE wonton soup. This was terrible. Fishy broth and mystery meat. I asked manager if it was fish broth and he said no. Chicken. Scared to eat it. Not kidding. Smelled like the Gulf of Mexico. Turned my stomach. I love ocean smell of salty air and fish but not in my chicken broth!!! My husband had a signature Chow Mein. Tasteless. Utterly bland. People, this was buffet quality, but worse. 

Now as I write this, I'm still in the restaurant. The waiter was kind and sweet, front manager VERY VERY attentive. This was something Kitchen related. Food MUST be revamped into Great Asian food to redeem themselves. I have a very hard time believing that Mandalay Bay is ok with this. FIX IT. I DO NOT return food. I will however tell a manager why I did not eat the food. And we did NOT eat the food (we did eat dim sum but not entrees). He seemed upset we didn't let him make something new. We don't do that. We just do not. It was all not good so what was the point? Was it suddenly going to become great?  I had a myvegas 15$ discount and after complaining manager took 10$ off. Our bill for inedible food was still nearly 60$ (with tip) for two. No alcohol. And no food to speak of consumed. Unacceptable.

This was a frustrating and not so tasty dining experience. 

We are at Mandalay, and I was overcome with a craving for noodles. The obvious choice (without doing the smart thing and jumping on the 15 and heading to Spring Mountain) was The Noodle Shop.

We were seated quickly, but it took quite some time for our waiter to take our order. When he arrived, we wanted his suggestions for the best noodles. He recommended a XO Vietnamese noodle with shrimp, the most expensive noodle. My husband warned me that the waiter was just trying to up sell the pricey dish. Regardless, it didn't sound too appealing to me, when our waiter returned, I went with the Singapore curry noodle. I wanted to get tofu instead of shrimp, but our waiter said it would be $2 extra! Sorry, but that is unacceptable. If I am not getting shrimp, there should not be an upcharge for tofu. So, I went with shrimp even though I wasn't planning on eating them. 

My husband ordered the $26 Vietnamese noodle with shrimp. That's right. He ordered the thing he had warned me against. Crazy husband.

My curry noodles were edible, but over curried (this coming from a die hard curry addict) and they were lacking that seasoned wok flavor. 

My husband's dish was sad. The portion was teeny, and the jumbo shrimp were no larger than the standard shrimp at Red Lobster. The flavor was just eh. He was so disappointed that he called over the manager and told her they should take the dish off the menu (true, but I was still embarrassed!). When he asked why in the world this dish was $26, she said it was the XO. For $26, my husband should have at least gotten tipsy off the noodles. He didn't. I am generally okay with a Strip premium, but this was unacceptable for a pretty casual dining experience with mediocre flavor and sub par service.  

My visions of a happy, noodle filled belly were squashed. Sorry, Noodle Shop, but there were just too many issues.

Rude waiters. Guy with the squeaky voice and bowl haircut gave me an attitude when I ordered takeout and then the food wasn't even hot when I got to my room. They also didn't pack soy sauce. 

The Singapore noodles ended up causing me to throw up. I think the shrimp was bad. 

Don't eat here. It's not a convenience and you'll hate yourself when you wasted money on an overpriced casino restaurant that makes Panda Express look like the French Laundry.
Bland soup. Spicy means it has garlic. Overall overpriced and not recommended. So sorry I hate submitting poor reviews.

This negative review does not apply to all the waitress here in this Restuarant.. The waitress that was serving us was not very friendly, he actually had an attitude with me and my boyfriend when we're ordering food. Never coming back here EVER again!
Bad Service!.
Way too over-priced for a not-so-great bowl of pho. The pho was bland and not worth $16. The duck noodle soup wasn't great either. The duck was on the dry side. I will never coming back!!!

I still like this lil Hidden hawaiian joint in the CAli hotel.  It's not fancy but the food is hearty and tasteful enough to make you feel like you're eating authentic hawaiian food.  We typically order the Saimwn, daily special, and musubi!

My plate of chicken chow mein noodles were: noodles and onions. Oh, and like 4 or 5 bland white kinda boiled pieces of chicken. For more than $20 what I wouldn't mind if it were a real chicken chow mein. 
Unbelievable all the floss in this 5 stars $$$$ Hotel!
See the picture.
This was a horrible experience.  Singapore noodles were the worst i have had. Prices were stupid for quality.

Should've listened to yelp reviews. This place is overpriced mediocre food restaurant. 

Tonkatsu ramen had 3 fatty chunks of meat we couldnt eat, watery broth, little bitty of green onions and nothing else. 

Dimsum for 2. DO NOT GET THIS. Comes out with 2 pieces of shumai, 2 pieces of shrimp dumplings, 1 leaf sticky rice, 2 meat humbaos. This is for 1 person, not for 2 people!! Not worth $30. This should be like $10. 

Don't recommend this place.

It turns out Mandalay Bay has pretty much eliminated their room service. So wanting something quick after a long day of working, I ventured in. Of course I read the Yelp reviews after I had been seated and was really nervous that I had made a poor choice.

I decided to go with simple menu items (how can they screw those ones up?) and avoided all the ones that were specifically reviewed as bad.

I went with the chicken satay to start and the Thai curry chicken as an entree. The chicken satay came out and was ok. The peanut sauce it was served with tasted more of taco seasoning (your guess is as good as mine on why) and was not a nice creamy peanut sauce. It wasn't bad, just not what I was expecting.

The Thai curry chicken was a generous portion. The chicken was a strange texture (boiled, maybe?) but tasted ok. The red and green peppers with it were fresh and pretty crispy still. The sauce had some yellow curry in it but not quite enough. The flavor was weak but the spice level was strong. The dish was ok. Not great and not terrible.

All in all, I probably wouldn't eat here again but it's not quite as bad as some of the other Yelp reviews -- at least not with my experience tonight.
This place was disgusting. Great service, but horrible food. Please don't spend your time and money at this place.
Had the Young Chow Fried Rice which was alright.  The pieces of BBQ Pork could have been larger and tastier.  Service was OK.

Good for a late night bite if you are in the mood for Asian.  I thought the service was fast and pretty upscale considering a diner like setup.  Food tasted good but no it will not be any kind of healthy so hit the gym in the morning after your late night bite here!

We should have checked the Yelp reviews before we went to The Noodle Shop at Mandalay Bay.   It is absolutely terrible.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.  

We ordered the "Roasted Crispy Duck" appetizer and was told that it actually wasn't crispy, but just roasted.  We got it anyway and it was disgusting.  The taste was lousy and it was some of the worst duck I've ever had.  

We also ordered the Cashew Chicken.  Our waitress came out about 5 minutes after we ordered and told us they were out of cashews, but they would make it without cashews.  Are you kidding me?  They ran out of cashews?

Our waitress was awful.  She was extremely annoying and her manager wasn't any better, as she seemed about as clueless as the waitress.  

I give you all the same advise I told people looking at the menu when we were leaving: this place is terrible.  Don't eat here.

Inside the Mandalay Bay. If you're looking for a hangover cure.. this isn't it.

Wonton noodle soup- 2/5. I suppose this may be relatively good here? Noodles are hard and soup is generic and MSG tasting.

Thousand year old egg porridge- 2/5. Bland once again with small portion of thousand year old egg and a measly small sprinkle of green onions.

Mongolian Beef- 1/5. More like elementary school 'mystery meat mondays' for $20.

Lettuce mince meat wrap- 3/5. Okay tasting but small portions, more like a small appetizer. 

High priced, but then again you are in Vegas so that's to be expected. But the quality is not good. It's much more worth it to drag yourself to a Pho place off the strip to cure that hangover.
I wish I could give it 0.00. It was not great, overpriced (26.00 for a very small entree and cup of streamed rice.  Don't go there.

Just ate at the Noodle Shop a few hours ago and everything was great! Being Chinese myself, I know what authentic Chinese food is, and this isn't it.  It's comparable to a PF Changs, maybe.  

I would probably never pay full price to eat here, I had a restaurant.com coupon that I used to get $25 off.  We had the sweet and sour chicken and the mongolian beef.  Both plates were solid and tasty.  Portions are just right and respective sauces were good.  

At the end of the meal, what was supposed to be a $40 meal after taxes and tip, came out to $15.  I felt a little bad since service was great, so I just tipped a bit more.  

I will probably be back next time I'm in Vegas, but i will be coming armed with a coupon.

This place was alright. There's not very much special about this place. It was the last minute lets go before it was close at 1130pm meal when the good restaurant was closed on the strip and every one from my party wanted noodles soup. Thai tea was watered down. The only thing good was the pho. Every thing else was bland. 

What was on the menu: 
Vietnamese beef pho
Curry fried noodles 
Duck noodles soup

I do NOT recommend wasting your precious time in Vegas by eating at this restaurant.  Not only are portions small,  the manager at the particular moment was not customer friendly & tried to give someone else's business card when I asked for hers. If this is her name, Yvonne Chow. SO UNTRUSTWORTHY. I Can honestly say I've never experienced anything like that before.  Unapologetic & rigid. What happened to customer service?  Doesn't exist here! I Wouldn't Expect This at Mandalay,  where we come each time we visit Las Vegas. NO STARS!!!

This was a lovely little place!

The service was wonderful - very, very friendly waiter. 

Food was really good too. I had sweet and sour chicken which was better than your average American-Chinese stuff. 

The pricing was exactly what I would expect from a similar hotel casual dining restaurant in Vegas - definitely no surprise there.

I'd definitely stop by again!

Spectacular in all aspects. Great Hot and Sour soup. Great Vegetable Egg Rolls (and mustard sauce and sweet and sour sauce)!  The Scallops and Snow Peas were to die for. I always find scallops to be unpredictable. (At worst, rubbery.). These scallops were tender and delicious. The service was fast and friendly. Table service was white cloth napkin and I thought it was above the "casual dining" it had been described as. We'll be happy to return.

This is a good spot for a casual/quick lunch. Food was great. Flavor was great. Ambiance and decor was really good. Price was more than what you would expect for a casual spot but not outrageous (~$20 per person). Service is good too. Again, good spot for quick lunch away from the hustle and bustle

I love ramen. Their ramen is not even close to what ramen should be. Soup is not creamy and not at all tasty. I believe it's not flavored enough and it's like a Chinese noodle soup, with simply clear broth with a little chopped  mushroom, scallions and bamboo shoots! It wasn't really special. The place looks nice but it's seems it's just a facade. I got frustrated there was nothing special with their food. And their servers too! They  seems to lack courtesy and We felt like I'm we were market place while dining. There were lots of shouting and sluggish  movement by their servers. There was even someone using a broom and a pan cleaning around the dining hall while we were there eating! Disgusting! I started to question why would Mandalay Bay have to have such a mediocre Chinese restaurant!

Food was good as you expect in Casino.

Price was high but it is in Casino.

Service was bad. It looked only a few servers including a manager tried to cover all, they looked overwhelmed. Everything was delayed. The bill they gave us at last didn't contain a customer copy.

So interesting to see in such business the middle aged manager took care of a bunch of junior cheer leaders to set up their table covers individually.

A short evaluation: they need to hire more people.

I don't understand how it survived this far and I regretted for taking a chance despite its low ratings on Yelp.

We ordered 4 dishes which cost almost the same as two dinner buffets but all of them were so disappointing that I left hungry. They were overly salty without the right flavors. Even Panda Express makes better Chinese food in my opinion.

I was out with the family and I was very disappointed. The service was substandard. I live in Nevada. People ask me for my recommendations all the time. Noodle Shop needs to remind their servers that people come to Vegas to have a great time and want great service. I am retired and I have a lot of time on my hands. I love to eat out. Sorry Noodle Shop. I shall not return.

Despite peeking at the reviews beforehand, my family and I went to the Noodle Shop since we wanted something light (after having buffet and steak the 24 hrs prior). We were promptly brought to a table. A lady took our drink order, but seemed to be a bit impatient when my dad didn't decide what drink he wanted right away. All of us ended up ordering different things and only my sister was pleased with her dish (seared sea bass), though she was the one who refused to go after I told her about the subpar reviews. My dish had crispy noodles and seafood. It was bland and the texture was sort of uneven (?). My mom's Vietnamese noodle soup was bland and my dad's Pad Thai had no sauce. The Thai tea was good and the service was kind.

Las Vegas has become an expensive place to eat. When you combine expensive with bad quality you have the Noodle shop. I'm not going to write much. They don't deserve it. Poor quality dished up as a lump of congealed noodles in bad broth.

From the moment we were seated, we felt like we were an intrusion for the people working even though it was not very busy. They made our order wrong and the food was just ok. Also, the menu is a mix of dishes - it isn't really a 'noodle' restaurant.

How can you make something like Pho taste like hot water and still have the nerve to call it Pho?!  When you're in Vegas you need something brothy to bring you back to life and this stuff just made it worse.  I even had to go down to pick it up because they don't deliver AND it's EXPENSIVE!  

Tried the bbq pork noodle dish too and that was a huge disappointment!  

I've said this before but seriously how are you still in business?!  Amazing!

Ok, dined here last night for the third time in 2 years. Sorry Mandalay Bay but the Noodle Shop is just terrible and horribly overpriced. I swear the chefs have no idea what chinese and thai food is supposed to taste like. If I buy an asian cookbook can I open a restaurant?  Seriously, for the third time the pad thai was a wattery soup that tasted like jiffy peanut butter.  The lettuce wraps had absolutly NO seasoning or flavor. The mu shu duck was fair but the pancake was so dry it just crumbled upon folding. Why is this place soooooo bad yet stays alive. If you think panda express is great asian food you will still be utterly disappointed! There are so many great noodle shops in Vegas that are traditional, delicious,  and less expensive, try the one in the back corner of the Venetian!

By the way, I was sober every time I've eaten here.

Do not waste your money or one good evening in Vegas.

I came here, starving, after unnecessarily fasting for over 15 hours (oh laziness, what you can do to a girl) I came here, STARVING. 
I was unpleasantly greeted with a line, however, I was delirious due to hunger so I waited. (I did notice like, 5 empty tables waiting for seats, but the this place was REALLY understaffed) 
I sat and ordered Thousand year old egg with shredded pork congee. My mother ordered wonton mein, and my sister ordered... pot stickers? 
This place was a mix of different kinds of asian cuisine, I managed to find a red bean beverage and pad thai (not chinese food) So this place could be your fix for all sorts of asian cuisine.
The staff understood cantonese, so they're authentic and my entree seemed legit. The congee was super flavorful but it was WAY thick... I'm not saying I like watery congee, but this was like pudding thick. Anyways, the pork was a tad salty, but overall, the congee was really good.
My mom seemed content (not stoked) about her wonton mein and my sisters pot stickers looked like fried sui mai. 
or not pot stickers of any sort, to be honest.

I liked this place a lot, if the service was better, I'd consider coming back within the same trip.. maybe, the price was very off putting though.

Walk away while you can.

Went to Vegas for a bachelor party and statyed at The Hotel at the Mandalay. After checking in my boy's and I needed a quick fix and wanted something quick and cheap, which we could not find at the hotel. So we ended up at the noodle shop. 

Long story short, the food was okay and we paid  around $11 for effing soup that was just blah. We were still hungry and ordered the combination fried rice which was $12 blah, but for $12 I was expecting a mountain full of rice. Instead we got a speed bump of rice. 

Overall this place was an overall bust, that placed $25 in my pocket. If you can't find anything to eat at the Mandalay that's quick and cheap I recommend walking a little further to the Luxor or go to the Cafe.

Saw that there were some mixed reviews for the place on Yelp but I was staying at the Mandalay and needed some food.  I was a bit disappointed in the Noodle shop.  The staff was a bit brusque and slow at times.  I felt that the service was extremely slow for an afternoon late lunch with a near empty restaurant while several staff members present.  Figured that the authentic service would be a good sign, but alas I was in for a disappointment.

The food was average chinese food that I could get in Delaware, which if you have read my posts before that is a very low bar.  I ended up getting the chicken lettuce cups as an appetizer and the Hong Kong style noodles with seafood.

The chicken filling was well made with a nice mild sweetness it.  The water chestnuts were chopped and crisp.  As a difference there was some pine nuts mixed in which was a nice crunch and flavor.  Chicken was moderate, but nothing special.  Disappointingly the dish came with only 3 leaves of lettuce for the dish, much too few.  The other problem was that they served it with ROMAINE lettuce, not much of a cup or able to wrap it up.  Poor choice of lettuce type.

Hong Kong style noodles were not freshly made, they were standard type thick noodles.  Not exactly pasty but pretty close.  The fish in the seafood was cold and flat tasting with a bit of gristle.  The shrimp was well seasoned and prepared but that was the only highlight of the dish.  Overall the dish was a bit oily and disappointing.

While I understand that the food would be a bit more expensive because of the location in the casino it was way overpriced considering the quality of the food.  The dishes were of low quality compared to what I would expect at Vegas in a casino.  I avoided this place during the remainder of my trip and would not return.

Yummy Singapore Noodles and pork dumplings. I love the little hot sauces they have on the table too, great for mixing with rice/noodles/ etc.
SUPER friendly service. Expensive -sure but still cheaper than the main restaurants! 
Save the money - don't eat at Shanghai Lilly -just eat at the Noodle Shop!
If you know Chinese food then keep on walking. Way overpriced for food that's not even as good as Panda Express.

This place is absolutely horrible. We ordered the Malaysian Laksa Noodle soup ($21) and Tonkotsu ramen ($17). Completely flavorless. The Laksa supposedly came with assorted seafood. Apparently that consisted of two shrimps, fish cakes, and fish balls. The ramen did not come with an egg and the pork was extremely fat. What a rip off.

I was invited to have dinner with my BFF and his family. It was my BFF's parent's fave place to eat, so we decided to give it a try. All I wanted was noodles. I was impressed with the ambiance, but then I thought to myself, this must be expensive chinese food to be this nice! 

The restaurant is spacious and I was surprised there was a lot of people dining here. We were led to a table, and our drinks were provided. I ordered the house special chow mein to share. When I received it, the noodles looked good, but the taste was lackluster. I had to add soy sauce to provide more flavor to the noodles. 

I didn't try the other items we ordered because I was craving noodles. My entree did its job filling me up, but disappointed the noodles lacked in flavor.

Came here cause my parents claimed that this is their favorite place to eat. It's a fairly small restaurant, but it wasn't that busy when we got there. We were seated immediately. We wanted to review the menu a bit before ordering. So they provided us with the water we asked for, but it took them some time till someone returned to take our order.

We decided to order the house special chow mein, BBQ combination platter, and the tonkatsu. I wasn't impressed at all with chow mein. It was bland and the noodles very wet. The BBQ combination platter had pork and duck meats. The flavor was very mild. Then there was the tonkatsu. Ramen is one of my favorite foods and I go to ramen bars regularly. This ramen was like your typical $1 Top Ramen. The broth wasn't the creamy pork broth. But the chasu was pretty good and a fair serving size. 

We had then waited for some time till we finally had tinhaik down the staff for our check. Food and service, not worth coming back to again. Sorry...

Amazing food! Reccomend Pho soup! Not with the beef it comes with though, that meat was disgusting! Minus the meat it was Amazing.. Mongolian beef was great as well! I felt the plates were pricey for being very casual dIning, also didn't serve you that much Meat. 
Great service, friendly & upbeat! Would reccomend!
Nice lunch menu for $19.  The Kung Pao Chicken was excellent (and I eat at a lot of non-Americanized Chinese restaurants.
We ordered the same menu as the day before yesterday. However, despite the same menu, there was only one vegetable. When we showed pictures, they added vegetables.

I wanted something warm and soupy so I had ordered the pho noodle soup (I figured they couldn't mess that one up even though it was a Chinese restaurant). The soup was lukewarm, noodles were not pho noodles and the thick slabs of beef were impossible to chew through. It was overpriced, bad food that gave me a stomachache right after.

Noodle House at the Mandalay Bay. 

Exactly what you'd expect from a Chinese Noodle House.

Price: Cheap.
Food: Will satisfy most.
Servings: More than enough for one, unless you always eat supersized meals.
Presentation: Nothing fancy, just straight out good food.
Taste: We've ordered a few of their dishes and no bad words were spoken, well except that their China tea which cost like a mother... The beef tenderloin noodle i had was delicious. 
Wait: It was fast, our food was served in the nick of time after we ordered, like fast food, except the food tasted better than we expected. 

Not a fan of noodle houses though. This place ain't that bad if you're craving for hot soup after getting buzzed.

Terrible service and terrible quality food. 

Ordered cashew chicken and received chicken and macadamia nuts. 

Everything was bland and overpriced. 

Panda Express is leagues better.

Avoid!

Had a craving for noodles so we ate at The Noodle Shop for dinner.

We ordered:

- 2 meat BBQ Appetizer - Duck and Pork - the pork was a bit tough and the duck was pretty good
- Beef Stew Noodle Soup - I liked the beef stew noodle soup - the noodle was al dente; the broth was good; the beef chunks were tender and there was some tendon and Shanghai Bok Choy  as well;  
- Shrimp Wonton Noodle Soup - Good wontons and good broth
- Beef Chow Fun - smaller than usual portion 
- BBQ Pork Noodle Soup 
- Choy Sum with Oyster Sauce 

Wait staff was attentive.

It was an OK dinner.  Not sure If I'll come back.

We thought it was great that we found a Noodle place inside, so we wouldn't have to drive the Strip, but Big mistake! The calamari came out breaded, fluffy, not really crispy, and lacked that flavor. I'm guessing the Ramen needed to be cooked longer, because the noodles were still slightly hard, and not the Ramen flavor. We should've taken the Drive...

Food here....yuck!  I ordered the seafood soup which tasted bland, others ordered the pho, Mongolian beef, etc, and all seemed like it was missing something.  Not talking about MSG, but it seems they didn't even bother to taste or season well the food.  And to compound our wonderful excursion, the waitress when giving the bill said, "Don't forget to leave tip!"  I usually leave more than 20% when I eat out, this time, she doesn't even deserve half that!

In summary, yucky food, high not worth prices, and rude service.  A must skip if ever in the Mandalay Bay Hotel!

Yes it's ridiculous to pay these prices for noodles.  But you know what, it's the middle of the night, you didn't think twice about the price you're paying to be staying at Mandalay Bay, and you want comfort food.  Pho, congee, pad thai, whatever your craving is after a long night.  This is it, lots of variety and be realistic - it's as authentic as you're going to find in a casino hotel.  Relax, think of it as your little oasis in Vegas.  Enjoy it; you'll win big tomorrow! Right?

Around the Excalibur-Luxor-Mandalay Bay corridor, your Asian food options are quite limited. I have to say that Noodle Shop was actually an ok place even though you are paying 2x to 3x more for Asian cuisine. You are definitely paying for the convenience, but it definitely hits the spot after a long night of partying. I had the roasted duck noodle soup and the preserved egg congee. The roasted duck noodle soup was pretty good, although after a while, you notice the heavy presence of salt. So, after I tasted too much salt, I tried to tame the salt with a bowl of congee. The congee wasn't good at all. I had to douse my congee with pepper to make it taste better which was disappointing.
Great food and the xo noodles are terrific.  The duck was very good.  All the soups are great!!

I learned the valuable lesson of what happens when you don't yelp a restaurant when traveling.. The Noodle Shop was utter crap... Overpriced and seriously mediocre.. I passed by the place and it looked  decent and it was jam packed with smiling Asian folks... I thought that was a good sign.., but boy was I wrong... I tried the seaweed salad with deep fried tofu, seafood wonton soup, and roasted duck/ BBQ pork combo.. The BBQ pork was decent but only had about four bites with the serving.. Totally overpriced $18.... The ice teas were like $4 bucks and of course 
you gave to pay for a "small" side of steamed rice... The rice was actually worth it's price tag, but really "how do you f$*k up rice"... If you have a need to waste money and torture you're taste-buds then the Noodle Shop will not disappoint...
* gave this place a second star  because the service was good despite it being packed....

One of the worst Chinese restaurants I've been to. The waiter recommends chicken chow mein saying it's full of vegetables ,only to find out onions is what he was referring to as vegetable. When asked , he says additional vegetables is going to cost you more!!  . Chicken fried rice is more like white rice with chicken.

If you are like me, you are reading this review as you sit at this restaurant wondering why everything is so awful. You may be wondering why an experienced yelper like myself would be checking reviews AFTER they are already eating somewhere. First, every other restaurant had a long wait. I was REALLY hungry, hubby wasn't feeling well and just wanted to get me fed so we could head up to the room. The empty restaurant should have been a sign, but I went for it because how much can you screw up noodles? Reception is always tough in casinos, so I didn't even try to check reviews. 

I ordered Pad Thai, my husband ordered wonton soup. I'm not sure I even can even use words to describe how seriously awful the Pad Thai was. If I was blind folded I don't know that I would even know it was Pad Thai. My guess would be that it was leftover noodles from a chafing dish at a 10 year reunion the night before. The flavor was awful, the texture bizarre, as hungry as I was I could not even make myself choke this down. My husband's soup was almost edible if you avoided the wonton. So basically the broth was bland enough to force it down your throat in a pinch.

I so very rarely send food back, but this was inedible and expensive to boot! I kept trying to flag a server down, finally after 10+ minutes I went up to the hostess and said I needed either a manager or my server. When the server came over I started to explain why I didn't like it. He didn't seem surprised at all, just took it away and asked if I wanted something else. I decided not to subject myself to anything else from this place. We paid for the soup and then headed over to a small souvenir shop in the hotel. We grabbed a bag of pretzels and called it a night. Those Rold Gold pretzels were AMAZING after the slop we'd had here.

I don't think there is anything you could do to get me to eat here again. Even if it was free! Even if I was hungry and given the option of this or nothing, I think I would choose nothing every time. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!! Mandalay Bay should close this place down and open a good noodle place. Noodles are awesome when you have had a little too much Vegas fun, and even if the noodles were just average I think it would do very well! If you saw a picture of how tired this place looks, you would not even think this would be open inside Mandalay Bay. This place needs to go!
Really horrible Asian food in Mandalay Bay, right next to the casino.  I ate there once and didn't go back.

I cannot for the life of me fathom how such an overpriced restaurant with less than mediocre food and SLOW service has succeeded here in the Mandalay Bay. 2 beers, a flavorless dim sum sampler for 2, and a very fatty, poor quality pork belly bao appetizer results in a $65 bill? VERY small portions. Staff were also unbelievably rude to the hostess, who was about the only one genuinely trying to accommodate guests. Come here again? GTFOH...

I visit the Noodle Shop at least once every time I go to Vegas. It's fast, easy and convenient.

I really like the curried Singapore Noodles here and order it every time! The pork and shrimp in the dish are delicious.  The moo shoo duck appetizer is ok and their honey bbq pork noodle soup is just ok too, I'd suggest sticking to the Singapore Noodles they're my favorite! 

If you're looking for a more formal sit down, full service experience go to Shanghai Lily or China Grill. The Noodle Shop is good for a quick casual meal.
